I have charged the MeMOPad about 3 days ago, and left the WiFi on, installed some apps, rearranged the desktop screens, screen brightness remains at about 70%, and had my kids play some of their education games it for about 1.5 hours, and the tablet still has 81% of the battery left!  Additionally, I am not sure what the button is called, but there is a 4th button next to the "go back button", "home button", and the "Recently used apps" buttion.  It is very nice, and appears to have nice little handy apps associated with it i.e. calculator, audio wizard, video player, unit converter, countdown timer, stop watch, compass, web browser, calender, and email.  It appears to be modifiable, and just adds one more spot for quick app access (wish the N7 had it).  A missing option on the MeMOPad is that ASUS and/or Android didn't include a auto adjust screen brightness option.  I usually use this option on my N7 for battery conservation, but so far, I have not seen that the MeMO needs it.Pros:  Made by ASUS, Memory card expandable, very inexpensive, great speaker, rear and front facing camera with excellent software, Android OS, awesome little included ASUS apps, Extra shortcut button at the bottom of the screen.  Mini USB charging port on the top and off centered (very out of the way of your hands when holding tablet landscape and charging).  Magnetic activated on/off switch on all supporting covers/cases (I hear you have to turn this feature on in setttings.)Cons:  1GB of RAM, Screen resolution 1280x1080, no screen brightness auto adjustmentBottom line:  If you are in the market for a 7" tablet, or something of that size and are on a limited budget, I would definitely recommend this one!  It is a budget tablet, but there is nothing cheap about it.  Don't waste your money on those cheap tablets that no one has ever heard of (Prestige, Dragon Touch, Chromo, Prontotec).  Those tablets are cheap for a reason. . . . they are CHEAP!!!  You will definitely regret it if you buy one of those as I have heard many people state.  Your choice, but I warned ya!

Reviews.Title: great for games, web surfing, and streaming media!
Reviews.Author: Emma
Reviews.Content: I bought this to supplement my laptop after its battery stopped charging which rendered it no longer portable. honestly, since receiving this tablet a couple months ago I haven't turned my laptop on ONCE. I use it to check the news and weather in the morning, keep up social media accounts, browse the web, watch movies, listen to music, play games, etc. and it'sstill running as fast and flawlessly today as the day I bought it. beautiful camera and plenty of memory. so glad I bought this!

Reviews.Title: A solid tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: CrimsonHail
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Android device and by far the best, had it three weeks. Great screen and battery life, good performance, cameras and sound. It's a little heavy, has no camera flash or light sensor and auto screen orientation is delayed but I still recommend this device.Ironic that today is black Friday and I got it $12 cheaper, win/win for me!Get the TransCover, it protects well and has convenient propping positions.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet ! besure you update it to android 4.2.2 from 4.2.1
Reviews.Author: A. R.
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet just make sure you go into settings/about tablet and check for updates mine updated the first time so the home screen will auto rotate the next update is to android 4.2.2 from 4.2.1

Reviews.Title: User review of the ASUS ME173X 7-Inch HD tablet.
Reviews.Author: RDO42
Reviews.Content: The ASUS ME173X-A1 tablet is an excellent buy, especially at the reduced price of $130.  It is my first tablet and I bought it to learn first hand the pros and cons of Android tablets vs  laptops.  I use it for monitoring and  responding to email, storing photos to show friends and family, querying the  internet, reading periodicals, novels and technical books, and news related videos.  The ASUS tablet does amazingly well given its size and processing power for email, internet queries, novels, and periodicals. The screen is bright, colors very good, and even the smallest fonts are readable.  The tablet comes with a number of very useful apps for email, internet queries, books and novels, maps, and GPS.  Although the email apps are focused on Google mail I found it easy to add my Hotmail account and have been able to use the core functions of Hotmail.  The Google search voice interface works extremely well.  I receive e versions of Newsweek, US News and Report, PC World,etc by email.  Most of the time I am able to read articles and watch news videos. However, there are times when the screen is so clobbered with advertisements it is difficult to see the text when the ads overlap the borders .  I have not yet purchased any apps specifically designed for displaying media on an Android tablet, but the included apps are generally doing a very good job.  I have experienced a number of problems with the screen freezing and having to back out of a query or e-periodical.  However, so far the system has not crashed and Chrome on the ASUS seems to stumble less than Explorer  on my desktop.  I am convinced that almost all of the these problems are the result of the advertisements overloading the processors, use of conflicting protocols, and in the case of Explorer on my desktop computer, conflicts resulting from my high security settings.  I always use  cases to protect both my ASUS tablet and Kindle ereader, was surprised to find out that when cased they are essentially the same size, and plans are to take both when on travel.  The apps included with the ASUS can work in conjunction with the GPS, and unlike my Garmin  can provide  true alternate routes.  This feature can only be used for planning because it requires Wi-Fi connectivity.  When not totally discharged, the ASUS recharges in several hours and battery life seems to be around 8 to 10 hours, depending on use.  I highly recommend this tablet to anyone who would like to start out with a reasonably priced tablet capable of large number of functions right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Design Flaw SD card Unmounts to easy from handling, due to platic body.
Reviews.Author: Kybosshog
Reviews.Content: I would give a 5 but a flaw in design makes it where I can't. The MAIN reason I picked this one over others was the SD slot. I understand to make stuff cheaper you use cheaper parts,  plastic over metal and so on.  Because the body is plastic it twists a little, if you push on the top right and bottom left or hold the bottom left and press the top right. This twist is so slight it's hard to notice UNLESS you have an SD card because it becomes unmounted and remounts over and over while handling the device. Sometimes it unmounts  just by holding the wrong way, yes it twist just the slightest. Also why have a device that supports OTG but not enable it (had to root to use)?  So any type of handling other than one hand hold to read can and will cause SD to unmount, remount over and over. So if for kids the SD slot is useless and that's the main reason to get this over others this price is/was the SD slot.

Reviews.Title: GREAT tablet for the money.
Reviews.Author: adam smith
Reviews.Content: I love this thing. I was gonna get the TF700, but who needs to spend $500 on a tablet? This plays video very well, it's a lot quicker than some reviews say, has TWO cameras, MicroSD slot, USB, it shoots 1080P video (which is ironic since it can't play 1080P), and plays most tablet games very well. The not being able to do 1080P isn't a big deal. On a screen that size you wouldn't be able to notice anyway.

Reviews.Title: Hardware good, launcher has crash problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Hardwarewise, the MeMoPad works quite well.  Very nice screen.  My only complaint is that the GPS needs a good view of the sky to lock in.My biggest gripe is the launcher.  I often get a launcher crash with the message "Unfortunately, the launcher has stopped..."  The only way out of this is to keep trying again to restart it and immediately touching Settings to try to clear the cache.  This usually seems to start happening after I download something from the Play Store.  I've complained about this to ASUS Tech Services but they haven't been able to help.  I've updated the system software (as of Nov. 13, 2013), but that did not fix it.  My workaround has been to install another launcher, like Lightning Launcher.  I don't' like that as much as the ASUS one so I try to limp along with it until it crashes again.

Reviews.Title: Almost Identicle to More Expensive Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: F. Cabanski
Reviews.Content: I previously purchased a Google Nexus 7 (first gen) and loved it.When a relative needed a tablet, but had a smaller budget, I purchased this tablet for her.  When it arrived, I was amazed at how much it looked and felt like the Google Nexus 7. It's about 60% of the price, but the difference in operation is negligible.I'm not a power user.  I read books, watch movies, play basic games (not the high quality graphic games), and use the white board for math tutoring.  In a week of using this the same way as the Nexus 7, my verdict is it's essentially the same (for these applications).The Nexus 7 is great.  In my hands, this is equal to the Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I wanted
Reviews.Author: K. Yeager
Reviews.Content: This tablet is working very nicely for me.I had one minor hiccup the first day I had it. The tablet was giving me an error message that the launcher had crashed, and the only thing I could do to actually get back to the home screen was to clear all data from the launcher, but the error came back every time I downloaded a new app. I performed a factory reset on the tablet and it's worked just fine since, so it was most likely an app that caused the issue, or possibly just a fluke.I love the size of this tablet. I'm using it a lot for recipes, and the size is perfect to allow me to see the recipe clearly without the tablet taking up a lot of counter space.I've also been using it for casual gaming, and the graphics look great.The camera's okay, there's a little lag with the shutter, but that's not one of the features I'm using regularly so it doesn't really bother me.It's also made a great replacement for pulling out my laptop in the morning or before bed for casual internet surfing and email checking.The sound is nice and clear, even when I have the tablet in the case I purchased for it.I think this particular tablet is great for someone who wants a tablet for casual use.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for about 2 months
Reviews.Author: Texasweety
Reviews.Content: I loved this but one day it started freezing and turned completely off. I let it die for 2 days and recharged it completely and it worked fine for another week. I would have to do this  at least once a week but now it won't do anything. I can't charge it, no buttons work. its a wrap and I'm so upset.

Reviews.Title: Dead after one month - no charge, won't start. Dead.
Reviews.Author: Brooke
Reviews.Content: Died after one month of use. Would not charge or power up. I tried the two recommended ways to get it to 'wake up', but it's a brick.

Reviews.Title: Big Bang, for a Little Budget!
Reviews.Author: E.M. Browne "erichitscar"
Reviews.Content: Very impressed so far! I've had the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 for about a year, and it was a fantastic tablet.  During that time, we had our first child, and now he loves anything that Mom and Dad hold in there hands. ie, our tablets and phones.  Worried that I would have to replace a $400 tablet because of drool, or it being dropped, we set out on a search for something a bit cheaper.We bought a used first gen kindle fire, and it was okay, but it was too slow, and we didn't like being tied to Amazon for everything. More research, lot's of web browsing and by accident I came across a blog about underrated tablets for under $200.  The Asus Memo Pad HD 7 was on that list!  I was intrigued, and started reading reviews on line, and found a sweet deal here on Amazon! for $129, this tablet is a great bargain!I've been using it for about a week now, and it is fast, the picture is great!, the screen is responsive and bright!My initial worries about buying a cheap tablet have been put to rest.  I will update this review after a month or so of use to give a deeper detailed review, but for now, at $129, this has been a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Diane M.
Reviews.Content: After having a very disappointing experience with a previous tablet I had ordered,  I cautiously decided to order the Asus Memopad.  I  absolutely love this tablet.  I have been able to get the games I like to play with no fees,  I have been enjoying books to read from Amazon free since theMEMO PAD comes with Kindle already installed.  I do all of my email easily and will be able to use Skype to contact family.  There are many things already installed which has made using the tablet very helpful.If someone is on the fence about giving this tablet a try, I would encourage them to go for it.  I believe, from my experience, they will be happy if they are needing a tablet easy to use and having many programs already installed. I do not need a tablet that has high technical abilities though this tablet  can likely accommodate someone who wants that.I hope this review will be of help.Diane

Reviews.Title: Tablet For The Ages
Reviews.Author: Michael Kerner "Michael Kerner"
Reviews.Content: There is no question that everyone is looking for a tablet, and ways to stay communicated with others on the go. But with so many different electronics out there these days, it can be a difficult decision. Tablets have came a long way since the Palm Pilots and the Iphone 6 years ago. But everyone has been on the Apple Ipad bandwagon since it came out 3 years ago. But with all of that, many might want to feel they are not wasting their money on one company, or just one product either. But with tablets it is very hard to find, not just in speed, but in battery life as well. ASUS has just gone into the tablet game awhile ago, and they have definitely a lot to prove with every other computer company as well. Well, there have been so many tablets on the market, but they have fell shy, not just in price, but productivity. Well, ASUS has tried their latest to the test, and it fairly does the job well.The ASUS MeMoPad HD 7 is definitely one of those tablets worth checking out not just in battery life, but also in playback and speed to get online as well. It has good wi-fi connections to get online, without the hassle of getting into a 3G network, good media playback and noble speed. What I do like about it is that it is very simple and easy to understand after a little time, and not longer unlike other tablets. I also like the fact that on this one you have a storage space for your external memory with a micro SD card expansion slot. This I like, because you can get more with a fraction of what you would pay for the Ipad. You can store as much as a 32 GB Micro SD Card, and it works nicely. What I did have a bit of a tough time with it though was trying to get online, but after awhile I found it quite easy. It also has good bluetooth connections as well, so you can use a wireless device flawlessly with it, from headphones to a computer keyboard. What I do wish for is that it would have better voice recognition, it has just as much of a lackluster connection as is with Apple's Suri voice recognition.  But at the end of the day, it works out mostly well for its money.All in all, if you really are looking for a tablet for yourself, I definitely suggest you give the ASUS MeMoPad a try. It definitely is a nice alternative to tablets that are more popular from the Barnes & Noble's Nook to the Apple Ipad and Ipad Mini. You really get nearly everything you want in a tablet or a smartphone, without the hassle in price. This is definitely a tablet I like from the speed and the connectivity, to a better value for your games, and communicating with others on the go. This is a nice device, and I suggest you give this one a shot.Price: BSetup: B+Convience: A-Battery Life: BOverall: B 1/2+

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: rnd402
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a week now and it is working super. I have loaded a few apps and watched a couple movies and have experienced no glitches. I highly recommend this tablet. The price is right too.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably Nice For The Money
Reviews.Author: Joe L
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend this tablet. It is quick with little to no lag, bright and responsive touch screen, and the Android OS 4.2.1 runs nicely. Almost vanilla rom with very little bloatware, which is nice compared to most other brands that load their devices up with unneccesary applications in order to make a quick advertising buck.For the other geeks out there that plan on rooting, there is a one-click root method already out that doesn't even require the user to use a pc.Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 of them and both are dead after one week
Reviews.Author: Bruno de Abreu Moraes
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 for my kids and after one week it simply got dead.Doesn't turn on.Apart form this horrible problem, it was ok.Hope ASUS help to sort this out.

Reviews.Title: having terrible luck with these tablets
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: Got 2 tablets for my sons for Christmas and the first one stopped working--simply wouldn't turn on anymore- by mid-February.  Had to ship it to TX to the Asus service center where they replaced the battery. It took almost 2 weeks for the repair and then they shipped it back to me via FedEx with signature required.  As I work full time during business hours I was unable to be home to sign for the package.  FedEx told me to ask Asus to change that requirement and Asus refused to help. I was lucky enough to have an ex-husband close to the FedEx station an hour away, and he was able to get the tablet, but it delayed getting the tablet back for my son for another week. It was torture for my 8-year old to be without his favorite toy for almost a month.  Then the second tablet quit working in April! Same problem. I paid another $15 to ship it to Asus. This time the screen got cracked in shipping (?? I had it wrapped good in bubble wrap and newspaper!) and they sent me an email a week later saying I needed to pay $161 for a new LCD screen. I replied saying I wasn't going to be able to pay that when it was more than the tablet was worth, and I waited to hear back. No reply for week. So I emailed again, did 3 live online "chats" with Asus and was just told to email again to ask if the tablet could be fixed without fixing the screen each time. Finally on May 23 (a full month from when they received the tablet) I heard back via email from Asus saying they would not fix the tablet without fixing the screen first. I replied saying to please ship it back to me to my workplace so I could sign for it there.  I received a generic email on 5/27 saying they would reply within 48 hours and have not heard anything since then.  My next move is to spend part of my 1 hour of time after my sons go to bed calling Asus to see if they will send back my son's tablet. I will have to find someone else to fix the screen before I have to ship it back to Asus if I want it to work again.  I have already had to purchase a new tablet (a Kindle Fire) so that my boys would each have a tablet to play with.  This has been the worst experience I've ever had with a product.  I would have accepted the bad battery on the first tablet as bad luck, but to have both of them quit working within 4 months says to me that Asus is not a good quality product. I am very frustrated and disappointed, and I will never purchase an Asus product again.

Reviews.Title: Major issues
Reviews.Author: buyermike
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these MeMo Pads (for me and my girlfriend) and after only a few months both are dead. After researching the issue I discovered this to be a known issue with ASUS and have seen dozens of complaints pertaining to battery failure. I am still waiting to hear back from ASUS on this issue, and will repost once I hear what they plan to do to resolve this. I have heard several people say that ASUS is not standing behind their products like they used to so I really hope that is not the case. It really to bad because when it was working I thought it was a pretty good little unit. Until this is resolved with the manufacturer I cannot recommend this product at any price point, unless you wish you throw money away.

Reviews.Title: Kids Love Them
Reviews.Author: M. Marhanka
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my boys, 6 and 4.  They have been using them now for approximately 6 months.  While some of the novelty of them wore off after a few months, they still use them a few times a week usually.  They each have a handful of games they play, but lately they use them more for watching Youtube or their favorite cartoons (TMNT and Paw Patrol).  These tablets have come in amazingly handy on long car trips or during "quiet" time when other people in house are sleeping.  They are also pretty sturdy.  The cases that I bought for them did not fit terribly well, so these have been floating around without any case or cover/protection, dropped a few times on flat surfaces, have not exhibited any kind of damage.  We have had to restart them a few times when it seems they get bogged down, kids get too much stuff going at once, but that is completely normal and necessary.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet IF you don't let the battery run down completely
Reviews.Author: banshee
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this from Amazon because I am a firm believer in trying out electronics in a regular store first so I can see what I'm getting, plus with having multiple problems with tablets previously I prefer the ease of returning them to a store. This is actually my second of these tablets. On that note, if I ever buy another of these I will buy it from Amazon.I've owned Galaxy tabs, offbrand tabs, 4 or 5 different ones, and returned them all because my cell phone has been faster, better screen, etc...and I saw no reason to have a "large cell phone without calling capabilities" as I saw them.  Everyone would tell me all the things they would do with their tablet, I would jump on the bandwagon, and 3 days later take it back to the store completely disgusted. On a whim I bought this one and my attitude changed.This tablet is incredible.  Let's start with the price. $140 is a great price for a tablet. To go cheaper you're either getting a refurbished one or some oddball no name one.  I actually looked at this, a Galaxy tab, and an iPad while at the store. What sold me what the size, 7 inch as opposed to larger (I like to put them in my purse, and with a case this one barely fits), but the big thing was it has a quad core 1.2 GHz processor. That's right, quad core. It's fast, it plays games and videos without lag, it also has bright great graphics, and best of all something called "smart saving" that helps your battery life. I'm a hardcore gamer (curse you Clash of Clans), playing mulitple games all day long when I really should be getting other things done. Instead of charging my phone twice a day I use the tablet and charge it overnight. That's it. I take great pictures of my cats and put them on the internet (might have the next grumpy cat phenom, you never know), and bluetooth them to my other devices. The camera is much better than most tablets cameras that take pictures like the old Kodak Instamatic cameras from the 70s.Downfalls. Sounded too good to be true, right? You'll notice I said this is my second of these tablets. These little gems have one very noticeable and well documented problem.  Don't let the battery run completely down.  There are no charging lights, there's a symbol for a second but otherwise you don't know if it's charging.  If it runs down you can't turn it on, you plug it in and get nothing.  Blank screen, dead tablet.  This happened to me a week after buying the first one, after charging for over an hour with nothing turning on I returned it and bought another.  17 days later I forgot to plug it in at bedtime and I knew the battery was very low.  When I got up in the morning it would not work. Wouldn't turn on, charge, anything. Tried 3 different chargers, my computer, nothing. Called ASUS, was told to send it back and they'd fix it or give me a refurb (which I HATE, if it's under a month old I should get a new replacement, not a repaired one).  After 8 hours of charging it showed a charge symbol on the screen for a second. Finally got it to turn on, and it showed battery at 48%.  Would I be this lucky again? Probably not. My luck doesn't work like that, I'm honestly shocked it finally turned back on this time.  It charged completely and the other thing that happened is I lost my pictures, which luckily I'd already bluetoothed to my phone anyway.If you can remember to charge the tablet I'd say buy it without question. It's the best I've seen, and I've owned tablets that cost hundreds more. Many hundreds.  Where are they? Back at the store. Where is the cheap little quad core? Sitting next to me. I carry it, my book, and my phone at all times. Speaking of, my game is calling me. Off to use it again!

Reviews.Title: Careful How You Handle It
Reviews.Author: Douglas Owen
Reviews.Content: When holding the tablet on the side where the micro sd card inserts, the tablet repeatedly unmounts and then remounts the sd card with the message that the card is being taken out and reinserted. You don't have to squeeze hard or do anything that could be remotely construed as mishandling the tablet in any way. Just don't hold the tablet anywhere on that side with sd card inserted, don't even touch that side.Thought performance could be a little better, but it does manage the battery well and the amount of internal memory is nice. Strange how a lot of mobile apps will ask to open in the browser when on other androids they operate independently. A lot to get used to when older, basic 'droids operate a little cleaner, but have less memory and less multi-core functionality.A good deal at $139, and the learning curve is worth the effort, but could be better manufactured.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: DuncanMacKenzie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet and from the first moment it was nothing but trouble.  It didn't want to charge, then it didn't want to power ON.  Once it was turned ON there was no way to turn it OFF.  The screen was completely unresponsive to either a finger or a stylus.  It was a complete disappointment.

Reviews.Title: WOuld not power up after 7 months. Called ASUS support and they provided a solution.
Reviews.Author: diwakar timilsina
Reviews.Content: Anyone having the issue where the tablet does not charge or powerup, do the following:Press all the three buttons at once for 15 seconds (Power/volume up/volume down). You will see a menu. Select "Normal" and enter. Tablet will work again.

Reviews.Title: Completely crapped out after two weeks.
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my mother, and she simply used it for web browsing, email, words games, nothing too stressful. Eventually, however, it just stop working and wouldn't turn on.Additionally it had tons of bloatware, useless apps, and a really  inconvenient user interface.If you want a good android tablet for the same price, get a Nexus 7, old or new. I've had one for almost two years and it's the one my mother is using now.

Reviews.Title: poor product
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: Bought this in august 2014 and it lasted just under a month before it died. Thankfully Amazon took it back and I never ordered another one. I check back once in awhile hoping the problems have been fixed but I can see many people have the same issue I did. I dont get how it has 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Bad luck or bad product?!
Reviews.Author: Ross
Reviews.Content: I own this tablet since Christmas 2013 (or little more than 4 months). Physically tablet was in my hands less than a mounth or two. Most of the time was for service and repair. Now is the fourth time for repair and always for the same problem, irresponsible screen. First time I sent it and I paid shipping but other three ASUS give me prepaid labels. Anyway it is very good and fast when is working, but other way I am looking how to take it a way. Also I am sorry to say that but Asus service representatives are not so good too. One of three (if you are luck to find it) will do the job done. Mostly they will let you do and listen BS. But that is something else. Good luck with yours.

Reviews.Title: I was really disappointed with this tablet
Reviews.Author: K. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this tablet. I had it for 3 weeks and loved it and all of a sudden it just stopped taking a charge. Apparently this seems to be a big issue with this tablet. I had origionaly purchased it from Sam's and they told me they had a several of them returned with the same issue. They weren't sure if it was just the lot they recieved or the model tablet itself... looks like it's the model itself. I was told by one of the manager's that even the 7" Samsung's were giving similar problems and I should look into the 8" and larger. I got an 8" Samaung and it's been great, no problems at all. I wanted to get the Asus because I really liked how easy it was to use but just because I experienced the problem I was afraid to go back to it. It took a little adjusting to the Samsung, but once I got used to it I was happy. I still wish the Asus didn't have the problem it has because I would get another one if it was dependable.

Reviews.Title: Lasted One Day
Reviews.Author: 4eyedworm "4eyedworm"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 11 year old a month before his birthday and didn't open it until two days before the celebration. It charged and started up fine. I updated everything it said to and downloaded his favorite game all in anticipation of a big surprise. However the next day when I brought it out to give to him the wifi was not working. After doing all things suggested and still no fix we have had to send it back to Asus because the time period to return it to Amazon expired. This appears to be a common problem. I highly recommend you open your device immediately so that you can have a seamless no hassle return through Amazon. Hoping that with the wifi fixed the tablet will be perfectly functional for an 11 year old. I'll have to come back and update to let you know.

Reviews.Title: Decent for this price
Reviews.Author: Rahul Sharma
Reviews.Content: Reason for just 4 stars is its ram.It has just 1gb of ram and could not hold many of high end games,but what would you get more at this price and that from brand like Asus.I like the customization from Asus, specially the floating apps and keyboard.In keyboard I like the numbers on top of the alphabets,it's helpful and convenient to use.The display is bright,but gets dull in bright sunlight.I like the look and design of the Asus Memopad Hd7I bought the blue one, and it's not completely blue it's an Royal blue, which I like the most.The back camera is incredable at this price.Front camera is also good.one thing I want to mention here that this tab is much better than Samsung galaxy tab3,it hangs alot.Casual games play very well.Can't expect too much from it as it's an budget tablet.I think its better than the old nexus 7 2012 edition.This tab is useful for casual users and not heavy users.If ur in a tight budget, go for this guys.It's not cheap looking toy plastic like Samsung tabs.It feel premium at its price.

Reviews.Title: Good Price, bad QA
Reviews.Author: J. Huang
Reviews.Content: -- Please also read the updates below --I gave average because of good price and bad QA.I have bought it on Thanks Giving day. I found it was a nice device with a good deal of memory and display. However, after using a month, the power supply was gone. So  I shipped to ASUS repair center. I had to pay for shipping, warranty does not cover for shipping for repair. Customer service is good and promptly responded. However, I am not sure if that was caused by their systems or persons, even though I called customer 3 times to make sure that my return address is correct before shipping back. They recorded my returning address wrong.  I have found out when FedEx started processing my shipment. I had called back and forth to correct my shipping address. Fortunately, it arrives to my correct address.After a few days of using, now I got another problem. Micro-SD card slot was broken. I cannot use for external storage. I need to ship back to ASUS repair center again.  That is pretty annoying. This year I have bought 3 ASUS tablets. The other two are refurbished. But those two are working fine. I got so many problems at brand new one.  That makes me reluctant to trust ASUS Quality on their own brand new products.04/07/2014 -----I think I need to update this to share my experience. After receiving back, I could only use about a week. This time, micro-SD card slot was broken. It could not read the card and the card was jammed inside the slot. The other functions work fine. I have no clue why hardware caused so many problems. Then I called customer support. This time, ASUS provided shipping back. But emailed me a few days later and told me that the motherboard was damaged and will cost me $191.85 plus shipping charge. That surprised me. Wasn't that happened at their own factory? My wife used that Tablet not even a month, mostly sitting on the table without touching since we bought. I asked them to ship it back if ASUS cannot provide any warranty their product's reliability, I would rather spend that money on non-ASUS product, than fixing that crap. It cost me $129 plus tax when I purchased. I still haven't got any email reply from ASUS yet. I will update this review once I get back my tablet from ASUS.05/15/2014 -----ASUS replied my email and told me they would fix the tablet without charging me. That makes more sense for accountability. After receiving my Tablet from ASUS, I have tried to use every day to see if any issue would show up. Everything works fine. They told me the damage was due to inserting micro-SD improperly. I don't think I had inserted improperly. I had a number of microSD devices. I have never had any issue like that. That must be mechanical design issue or QA issue. Now I have to be very carefully inserting microSD card. Anyway, I appreciate ASUS took care of its product and shows itself accountable. My suggestion to ASUS is to put more effort on QA by considering every corner case which could lead the product to damage and design to prevent it. Reliable quality can win customer confidence.  My suggestion to buyer is to be careful when insert microSD card. For transferring information from micro-SD card to computer, use USB cable. Files transfer using USB is pretty fast for ASUS tablet. It is better than Samsung tab-2. I don't find any problem in my tablet after using a few weeks. It functions pretty well now.

Reviews.Title: RIP OFF ALERT ALONG WITH WORTHLESS WARRANTY!
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I bought the ASUS tablet from here in November with the square trade warranty. The tablet was great for a month until it started to freeze and now wont even turn on. No damage to it whatsoever by us, kids, accidents, etc. (Not even one drop). The warranty only covers spills and drops so i have to deal with ASUS for the problem. They want me to pay to ship it etc etc etc. By time I am done with it, it is not worth the hassle or the cost. BUYER BEWARE! Don't say I didn't warn you!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet so far!
Reviews.Author: Judith Wallace
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet for my 8 year old son BD, he only started using 2/22/14. So far so good, no problems with functionality, its fast, viewing is great and its holds a charge all day! so we are not constantly charging, the battery economy feature works. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because, of the placement of the power button and volume button. Inside the case its hard to access, they needed to be on the side of the tablet, not behind!

Reviews.Title: Dead after 3 months use!!! Stay away!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lynn Rickman
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes for this tablet but it has died 3 months after light use. ASUS customer service is horrible and it appears that this "suddenly dead" problem is happening for many users. Save yourself a headache and look further for a good tablet.

Reviews.Title: This product failed along with all my notes and data
Reviews.Author: amazonaddictee
Reviews.Content: Returned this product because it stopped working. The back-up for the notes app failed as well and I lost all my personal and work notes. Their Asus customer service was bad as well.  I will not buy an Asus tablet again. I am thankful that Amazon.com has great customer service and took back the faulty tablet.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Lori Partridge
Reviews.Content: Mine will not turn on now. I cannot return or exchange it. The time has passed to do so. Save your money and pay a higher price for something you know will last. I bought in November.

Reviews.Title: bad experience
Reviews.Author: JEANFRANCO "jeanfranco"
Reviews.Content: downloaded the product arrived I thought 2-hour charge it try to light and did nothing was dead now I have to take it to refund'm outside the United States and super expensive fresh

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I researched 7" tablets for a long time.  I needed something light and portable to carry with me for my writing.  While my phone was capable, it was really too small, and with that sort of use, the battery didn't last long.  Trying to put my laptop in my pocket also didn't work out.  I had settled on one particular tablet, and just as I was about to buy it, it was out-of-stock.  Then I came across the ASUS MeMOPad.  It did everything I wanted, and claimed longer battery life, so I bought it.  The first day my wife wanted to go shopping, I had a chance to really test the battery life.  I unplugged it at 10am, and used it a lot.  By the time I plugged it in again that evening (11pm), I had finished writing a chapter and it still had 57% battery charge left.  An added benefit was that since I wasn't using my phone for writing, it didn't go dead in the middle of the day.  (Hint: On any device, when you leave home make sure you turn wi-fi off.)

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: William T. Bode
Reviews.Content: I think this an excellent tablet, clear screen, fast loading for apps and internet, the battery seems to be strong,I am one Jehovah's Witnesses and I only use it going door to door as I have the bible loaded on it. I would have given it 5 star had it not been for the on off switch located slightly to the rear of the tablet. I bought the Asus cover and getting to the switch is a little difficult for me. As I don't take pictures I cannot comment on those features but the couple I have taken as a trial were sharp and clear.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet but....
Reviews.Author: robyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a Christmas gift, on the first day, the charger didnot work out of the package. Contacted Amazon and reordered a new charger. Some three months later, the charger is once again no longer working. Amazon cheerfully helped me after two attempts to contact ASUS and being hung up on by their customer servcie representatives.ASUS needs to learn customer service! If given the opportunity to buy this tablet or another comperable tablet, I would definitely not purchase an ASUS product again!

Reviews.Title: Perfect except battery/charging issue
Reviews.Author: Walton Macey
Reviews.Content: perfect for the price, battery charging issue after a month. I have to return it under the factory warranty. Tablet will not turn on or indicate that it is charging.

Reviews.Title: 8 days and will not power on again BUT  READ UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Manfred K. Dulle
Reviews.Content: 8 days working.. liked it.. will not power on.. RMA  at my expense.. DEVOUT ASUS FAN,, motherboards and video cards.. THIS IS  J U N K  ...  UPDATE  ASUS  tech support, accepted an RMA and in 13 days I had a BRAND NEW one back in my hands.. It has worked flawlessly..Apparently there is some glitch with these devices, that hard locks the machine if you let battery go 100 % dead .. Asus claims it is software related, and FIXED at thisa point..  THIS  tablet takes INCREDIBLE PHOTO's  All in all I WOULD reccomend it at this point.. But it was a rocky road getting there.. ASUS  has never let me down and again they come through!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Javier Duque
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item thinking it was a very great buy. I was sorely disappointed. After completing the initial set up, I received a notification telling me to update the system. I let it download/install, it has been stuck on "installing system update".

Reviews.Title: Thought I wouldn't be writing this one star review!
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought the tablet as a gift for my six year old son and from the beginning battery issues. The battery would last 1 hour and take 7 to charge, three weeks later wouldn't take a charge or power up. I give amazon's return department 5 stars. I didn't want to pay for shipping to asus three weeks after I bought it, and get refurb after refurb with the same issue. I thought twice about getting this tablet glad it wasn't to late to return. Who knows buy one have it break and asus might send you mine refurbished and it'll last you 3 weeks like me. Don't make that mistake get a Samsung or Apple tablet bottom line YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.

Reviews.Title: 4 Months and its a paperweight...
Reviews.Author: Shawn Mckean
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on October 4, 2013, by February 18th its a paperweight.  Asus customer support is a bit difficult to get ahold of and the squaretrade warranties sold by amazon only cover the period after the manufacturers warranty expires..

Reviews.Title: Sorry but device stopped working in less than a month of use
Reviews.Author: JG "lovetoread"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my mother who used it to occasionally check email and play candy crush.  It just stopped working. Easy return  with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Bright display, love the interface
Reviews.Author: RickMay57
Reviews.Content: Device works great right out of the box with 1 exception, purchased device with an memory card, and every time I move the device, it says that the memory card was unexpectantly removed... the card was not removed. I suspect a mechanical issue but have not sent it in for repair yet.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: ttucker
Reviews.Content: We had to exchange it 2 times and both times it did not even work.  My sister had purchased one also and the screens cracked very easily.  Of the 2 we purchased they both ended up getting sent back and Samsung tab 3's were ordered in place of the memo pad.

Reviews.Title: good device
Reviews.Author: Paul Malcher "Paul M"
Reviews.Content: I am going to be direct here it's a really good device. Unless your look looking for high end hardware or gammimg hardware specifically. I bought it for media such as Netflix and to replace my nook. It's does a fantastic job without being slow or having a bad screen. I used to have a Lenovo ideatab which was okay but my years of owning a high end smartphone made me want better. This fit the bill perfectly. Handles multitasking well, mostly stock android with a few asus additions all of which are pretty good. This is also one of many asus products I own and thus far it lives up to what I expect quality wise from asus. Bottom line if you want a cheap but good and capable tablet this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Aimee
Reviews.Content: I got this for a trip so I wouldn't have to carry around my laptop and go through security hassle of taking it out. It fit in my purse perfectly! This is the first time I've used touch screen, much less adroid OS and I was able to figure it out pretty quick. The front and back facing camera are a nice bonus and the reason I waited for this model to come out. It has a great battery life. You only have wifi, no mobile service available but that is what I would have had with a laptop so I'm fine with that. I've used it every day since I got it and it's still working great after 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Black Screen of Death. I do not recommend it
Reviews.Author: Edneide
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to say that I'm a big fan of Asus, and I have been using their motherboards on my PCs since ever.I bought 2x Asus Memopad HD7. One for my wife and one for my kid.At first I was really pleased with the quality, it's solid, not heavy and pretty thin.But, after 2 months of usage, they both had a charging problem.The tablet simply shut down, and wouldn't charge nor restart.After sometime (1 - 7 days) they suddenly came back to life.This happened about 4 times already. It's pretty weird.I really didn't expect something like that from an Asus product and it's disappointing.I do not recommend this Tablet for anyone, on my concept it's a buggy device.

Reviews.Title: Died Within a Week
Reviews.Author: Ed "Ed"
Reviews.Content: This is a responsive and capable little Android tablet.  However, like so many others have reported, it dies suddenly and it will not take a charge.  I had to chat with a ASUS customer service person to get an RMA.  It took a long time to get this done as their rep. was chatting with several other customers at the same time.  I would respond to his questions and then wait a long time for the next step of their process.  I finally had to complain about the process taking so long.  The tablet is on its way back to ASUS.  I am really disappointed.  This product suffers from either a serious manufacturing defect or a serious design defect that passed all reliability testing.  The tablet obviously passed the end of line functional test.

Reviews.Title: Stopped Working
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: My daughter bought one of these and it stopped working after 13 days.  Luckily, we were able to exchange it for another one.  Unfortunately, its been almost 60 days, and the second one stopped working as well. Same problem.  It won't turn on.  Contacted ASUS, and still waiting for a resolution.  Not sure how this tablet got such a good rating

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son for Christmas.  It had great reviews so I bought it.  While it worked my 33 year old son loved it.All the bad reviews were that it stopped working before a month was up.  I was hoping he would receive a good one.  Nope. Crashedafter 2 weeks.  Very disappointed. Sending it back for a replacement as I cant seem to exchange it for another model.  Hope # 2 will work forever...

Reviews.Title: good products
Reviews.Author: colleen
Reviews.Content: I've only had this for about a month but so far so good. easy to use and haven't had any issues with it.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: gs
Reviews.Content: Exceeds my expectations . It does so many things that more expensive tablets don't do. Runs fast excellent battery life. No complaints  here...

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Very fast and good display. Apps run smoothly. Netflix looks great and has no lag. Love the kindle and zinio apps for reading.

Reviews.Title: Great Product-Reliable
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had good experience with my ASUS Essentio PC for 3-4 years so shopping for a tablet was easy. So far I've had no problems!

Reviews.Title: A great Gift
Reviews.Author: ginw
Reviews.Content: My husband is technologically challenged but this tablet has made it easy for him to learn the apps, programs, etc.  So made for anyone.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav
Reviews.Content: Cheap, reliable and sturdy. It serves all the purpose of a basic user. Only problem is that sound crackles at high volume.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Boschert
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these for my daughters 8 & 7, to replace aging Lenovo tablets. White for one, Pink for the other.Had originally purchased the Galaxy Tab 3 7.0 but didn't realize they only had 8GB ROM, lesser screen quality, and older processor.The Asus is perfect, long battery life, nice screen, and runs great. It is a little laggy scrolling in the App drawer, but it is a huge upgrade over the Lenovo A2100 from just Dec 2012.There was an immediate updated to JellyBean 4.2.2 not sure of the enhancements as ASUS has its own skin. There are some Apps that come preloaded from ASUS, have tested them so cannot comment.It does have a Parental lock that can be setup and then monitored via web browser to set and change device time allowances. But it has to be activated each time the tablet is turned on, so not very efficient.Since they are for my girls , I haven't played with them too much outside of initial setup. As an e-reader/video streaming device it is great. Kids games it works great too.The only device I would have gotten over this would have been the LG GPad 8.3 or Kindle Fire HD(X). The Fire simply because I just found out about the Amazon Prime being being able to download video on demand for offline use and the build in Parental Lock features But the lack of expansion and full Play Store gets me.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Christopher T. Owens "revbones"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and when setting it up was blown away by the responsiveness, screen clarity and overall speed.  I personally have an Asus Transformer Infinity and a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Ed so I went in with low expectations.  While the resolution obviously wasn't at the Note 10.1 2014's level, it was crystal clear and for the size I didn't note any jaggedness or pixilation.  The speed was on par with any other tablet and just felt zippy.I'm not sure you can get a better deal for the price.  I certainly couldn't find one and was really happy with it as a gift but I honestly wouldn't have minded one for myself.Whole-heartedly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: the best !!!!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The screen rez and size alone make it a five star tablet but then add it's ability to do everything else , to much to go in to for a short review but I will say the only thing it may not be the best with would be graphically heavy games but that's not why I have a tablet. I do play games but that's not my main use mostly reading watching netflix and using it for work. For the price it is the best out there !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Joyce McCray
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter and she just loves it.  She is a dancer, does a lot of videos and pictures of performances.  She was so excited and just loves it.

Reviews.Title: so far (after 2 months) very satisfied with the tablet
Reviews.Author: skyfoxx
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to snag it when ASUS was promoting it at Amazon and for a few days the price was incredibly low - 109.95 or smth like that. Compared to how much I paid for my Archos 7 three years ago... well, let's not compare because there is no point.Anyway, here is the short list of Pros and ConsPro:a) the tablet has not crashed even once. I use it every day to read books, watch videos, write emails, browse the web, run some simple utilities, install games and such, but nothing extra-fancyb) with the Wi-Fi constantly on, the battery life is quite impressive. I recharge it once a week (depends on how much I use it, but I am saying on average).c) speed is very good. Much much faster than my old Archos but that goes without saying. Faster than Galaxy Tab 2, that's for sure.d) I found very nice and inexpensive case and accessories for it (tablet kit by Birugear with screen protectors, case, travel chargers etc)e) display is good (not Retina-great quality but very good for my purposes). Unlike some other older displays, the viewing angle is pretty widef) had no problem working with microSD cards, no problems with connecting to my PC to transfer dataCons:a) as I said the screen is OK, not great. Decent... not sure if that can be listed as a con but wthb) some areas of the screen (corners) seem to be slightly less sensitive to the touch than others... not by much but still.c) power and volume buttons are located a bit awkwardly, it  takes a while to start properly pushing them. The other side of the coin (positive side) is that you will never push them by accident (at least not when it is in the Birugear case)OVERALL: for 110 bucks it is an amazing bargain. If I could buy 8 Gb version for, say, 80 dollars, that would be a great present for my kids.

Reviews.Title: Amazing bargain tablet.
Reviews.Author: arivas
Reviews.Content: For the money, it cannot be beat. If your low on cash [I'm a struggling college student] this is the one. I first read about this on Laptop mag and PC mag when I was reviewing cheap tablets. Both of them named the ASUS highly and that was enough for me.

Reviews.Title: I love my tablet...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: ... because It has great graphics, and no lag! My brother has the same tablet, which he would have happily shared with me when I wanted to try it out before I ordered my own, but Now It's been a few days since It has arrived at my mailbox. I would recommend this to a lot of people, including my friends at school, and at the school my brother goes to!

Reviews.Title: An excellent value in terms of performance, usability and quality.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought two ASUS HD 7 tablets, one for my wife and one for my son and they both love them. (I've set up and installed apps on both my wife and 8 yr old son's HD 7 tablets). The tablet is an excellent value for the money and, imo, is currently the best value on the market in its price range. While ASUS makes both the ASUS HD 7 and Google's Nexus 7, I prefer the HD 7 due to its microSD slot (which accepts up to 32GB cards), whereas the Nexus 7 does NOT have a micro SD slot (Google is hoping its Nexus 7 users pay for a subscription to their cloud-based data storage service; in our family's case, we use the HD 7's microSD card along with our own cloud-based server).Everything I've loaded on to our our two HD 7s has ran well and the tablets have been very reliable; one tablet is 3 months old, the other is only a couple of weeks old.I would strongly recommend this tablet to anyone who is in the market for an inexpensive tablet.

Reviews.Title: This is a great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Ghost rider
Reviews.Content: I got one of these at from Micro Center and wow!  this tablet is great!This is my 2nd Android tablet and I have a IPad one.This tablet had no lag moving around on the screen, the battery lasts a long time.I would recommend a screen protector and a case for it.if you want to load movies on it, I would recommend a 16 or 32 gb Micro sd card.But I like it so much we are ordering one for my father-in-law

Reviews.Title: Nice Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: funnymama
Reviews.Content: I have had it for a short time, but so far the functionality seen fine. I still have a lot to learn about all its functions, and I have some difficulty with the touch screen reaction time and sensitivity. However I have had this same issue with two other tablets that my family owns.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Michael Goldsmith
Reviews.Content: We chose the little Asus after a bit of research. It's one of the best bargains out there for a tablet IMO. It's got good speed, an excellent screen and 2 cameras compared to none on the Kindle Fire HD, and only one front-facing for the Fire HDX.The only two complaints I have is that I wish it had 2 gigs of RAM, but 1 is standard in this price range across manufacturers. The other is that although the screen is bright with punchy colors, the glass picks up smudges and fingerprints like crazy. Still, I'm very pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Great price, nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Doug Didier
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet for my 5 year old daughter.  Her brothers both have the old editions of Nexus 7s and are pleased with them, but the Nexus is a bit more expensive and being 5 I have my doubts about if this won't get stepped on/broken/put in a toilet, so I wanted to minimize spending.  The display is nice, the processor is quick, and it's pretty obvious to tell this is just a  slightly lesser version of the Nexus 7.  The construction quality feels a bit cheap, but I got a protective case (bobj gear FTW) so that wasn't as big of an issue.  I did have a few software bugs (Unfortunately launcher has stopped was the error, preventing me from doing almost anything) but I reset the tablet (done under settings) and updated the firmware and all is right with the world.Pros:  Good display, nice camera, quick responseCons: Construction seems cheapAfter getting this for the Daughter, my wife purchased one as well.  She is equally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Buy it people.
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Works great so far,i would recommend this to anyone looking for an entry level tablet that is inexpensive and is great for my kiddo.I find myself using it more than my son.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Kerbear
Reviews.Content: I read and read and read reviews before finally selecting this ASUS meMOPad for my 8 year old daughter.  We have only been using it for about a week, but so far it has proven to be awesome!  For a child (or for myself for that matter), I just couldn't justify purchasing a $400+ ipad.  This tablet, with a $150 price tag, will not disappoint!!!  It is actually much nicer than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Great Android. MicroSD Mount/Unmount Issue (Solved)
Reviews.Author: sofla
Reviews.Content: I really love this Android tablet and it deserves a good review. I had the problem where the micro SD memory mounts and dismounts and mounts, etc. Someone in one of the reviews tried putting some card board behind the chip. I cut the corner off of a business card and slid it in with the SD chip. So far, problem solved. Otherwise, I love this thing for $129. Mine is blue.

Reviews.Title: it's everything my son wanted!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: My son is in his twenties and wanted a tablet that he could use. For FB and to play poker, as well add take pictures, and this fit the bill!!!!  He is pleased and I checked consumer reports, this model was a "recommended buy"

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Christopher Bishop
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am very happy with it.Inexpensive enough to use heavily without being afraid to break it. I considered getting a case then figured why pay 15-25% of cost of the tablet for a case? I can just replace the tablet.It does everything I want: browse internet, watch internet videos on most sites, android apps...I still need to set up for e-reading.Browsing and use speed are sufficient--I haven't had any serious performance hickups that have made me feel that it would be worth it to spend more $ for faster perfromance. Then again, I am not editing excel, powerpoint, or video...just consuming content.Many options between the ASUS installed apps, Google branded apps, and everything available on android/play. In many cases many there is overlapping in uses/purpose among these 3, so you have many options to choose from.I compared to other known brands under $150. The Walmart 7" (was it HiSense?) which had a mini-HDMI port but only 8gb, no expandable memory, and I think worse screen. Also compared to the Kindle Fire HD and I think the Memo HD had faster performance (and I liked the idea of sitting outside the Amazon pay gardens).One cool feature is the ability to set up several user profiles so different family members can manage their own desktops, apps, and profile logins. The downside is that it appears to install duplicate copies of apps if both users install it (ie 2 copies of Facebook app). This might eventually affect storage capacity but with 16gb I'm doing ok.One small issue was that, at first, I had trouble using earphones. The earphone jack would not enter all the way into the plug--even with a somewhat above normal amount of pressure. Therefore sound would cut back and forth between the speakers and earphones as connection with the half-inserted jack was made and lost. After a few uses, I was annoyed enough that I decided that I would just force the jack all the way in and return the whole thing if something went wrong. Well, it worked and the plug has been normal ever since--a normal amount of pressure to insert and remove and sound is 100%.All in all pretty good--but I would have loved a mini-HDMI

Reviews.Title: Pathetic Build Quality
Reviews.Author: philip murphy
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet except for one thing. I've had two of them die in a month. As far as I can tell, the weak link on this tablet is the build quality. The power switch was always a bit sketchy on my first one. It wouldn't always wake up on the first try. Then about a month after I got it, it went dead. I returned it. Unfortunately the next one died the second day I had it from the same problem. I'm going to try something else next time.I have no idea how this slipped through Asus' QA, but this is a terrible flaw in this product. Just get something else. I've definitely lost my faith in Asus over this.

Reviews.Title: Back to Back Cameras and additional memory storage
Reviews.Author: Melchor S.
Reviews.Content: For the price, speed and performance this is excellent to me, only I don't know how durable this device is.I have a Kindle FireHD but my problem is it doesn't have a rear camera on it and there's no slot for  microSD unlike the Asus Memo7, I recommend this Asus Tablet all.

Reviews.Title: Asus tablet
Reviews.Author: C. F. K. "Fussy"
Reviews.Content: Didn't like at first, couldn't get netflex, but recent update by Asus fixed that! That is why I gave it 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: corrected review-45 days old and died
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ben"
Reviews.Content: tablet completely died while charging.  i went through all the troubleshooting, cycles, and every permutation of holding down buttons.  It looks like a common issue.what fixed the issue was that the battery is picky and high voltage wall charging can cause an issue from time to time.  I resolved it by charging it via my laptop and USB cable.The tablet itself has mediocre build quality, but the flip side is it is very light.  I dropped it a few feet and the screen shattered, so i would recommend a case.  The hardware and battery life is great.  The screen isn't quite a retina, but you're payinhg $150 for it, instead of $400.  It was a no brainer for me, and the tablet does most nearly anything you would like it to.  In addition, it has expandable storage which most other tablets do not have.Overall a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!!!!
Reviews.Author: ivan_hrusovsky
Reviews.Content: Worth the money, its fast for gaming, it can handle GPS navigation, music, pictures... Plenty of fun for couple of bucks. You don't need to by any extra sd card, you'll be rewarded with 16Gb of internal storage + 16Gb Asus cloud which is enough. However you may want to have more extra storage - get a micro Sd card. I bought 64Gb. S***ty Apple haters gonna hate, but this tablet has the power of iPad mini, has more storage, is 7" - great to hold in hand, is very cheap. On the other hand, there are two negatives - its heavier then iPad and the charging. I have US version and it charges up just till 40% of capacity here in Europe, the only way to get it fully charged is to connect it to a computer.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: John C "John"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I had no idea what I wanted or needed in a tablet. While reading the reviews here on Amazon of tablets in the $100 range, someone mentioned this one. I was impressed with the Quad Core processor and the 16 Gig of storage. I found the MeMo for $129. I decided to spend the extra money based on the favorable reviews. I am very happy with this tablet. It seems to do everything I want it to do. The 5 megapixel camera is another good feature compared to the cheaper units. I added the 32 gig micro sd card, a Poetic case and a bluetooth keyboard.The MeMo connects to my laptop without a problem. The first thing I did was to transfer the owners manual PDF file to the external card and install the Adobe reader from the Google Store. It does not come with a manual and if your new to tablets, it is well worth reading.I have also installed a couple games and a couple free books from Amazon. My wife bought a cheaper tablet from Walmart which pretty sure eventually she will give to the grandkids. Then I will buy one of these for her.

Reviews.Title: One of the best 7" tablets!
Reviews.Author: Vladimir Buriko
Reviews.Content: Great product - a lot of features offered for very low price. The Micro SD Card Reader Slot is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Anna Smirnova
Reviews.Content: Of course can not be compared to Ipad but for the price it is working great. The screen has very good resolution, though it might be a little more responsive. The tablet itself looks very nice. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: JAC
Reviews.Content: Already had the Asus transformer prime, but wanted a 7inch tablet to carry around with me. So sfter reading other reviews, purchased this one and I have not been dissapointed. Good build quality and operates like a dream. Quite fast and simple to use. Many built in apps some good and some not so good, but hay ho you only need to use the use the ones you want to.

Reviews.Title: Nice and elegantly built iPad Mini competitor with havled price
Reviews.Author: Ming Yu
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and high quality built Android device.I got it for approx. $130.00 prior to Thanksgiving.I have used Apple iPod and iPad for long time but decided to try Android.Never regretted that I have made a wise decision.This device has a 7" wide screen IPS monitor, which is crystal clear; compared with apple iPad mini, it is equally capable but with halved price.Basically, Google built an equivalent tablet world(i.e. Android tablet OS, Google play Android App, etc) and Asus elegantly implemented the hardware.I especially like the widget feature, which is not provided on Apple devices yet. Probably, Apple has better marketing and I definitely prefer Android over Apple IOS now.

Reviews.Title: Very nice value.  Good on it's own merit.
Reviews.Author: S. Chang Kim "Changster"
Reviews.Content: I thought I made a mistake when I saw the Samsung Tab3 for a similar price, and was going to return it.  When it arrived, my brother who got this compared it to the Samsung Tab3 I got my GF and loves it.  Except for the screen it's a clone of the Google Nexus.  Add some memory and it's good to go.

Reviews.Title: Asus MeMMoPad WONDERFUL!
Reviews.Author: SASS "Sandy Fleming"
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. I've had several quality tablets and this is by far the best. Amazed at this 7". I know Asus is Top of the line,but this new MeMMoPad is so easy to use for hours st a time.I was pleased with shipping time and how easy this was to set up. Turn it on and ready to use in nothing flat.Camera is wonderful with so many cool features. I've made some awesome ones for listing on CL nd EBay..Love it !! Has all I ever need. Just almost like their big tablet.All HD looks great !!

Reviews.Title: I love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Carmelo
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. It's everything I was looking for in a tablet. I've had other  tablets and this one far is the best one.Love watching movies, the screen is so beautiful. The battery last a long time. Gonna buy a 32gb micro SD card so I can take all my music and movies everywhere.....

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: David Wilhelmi
Reviews.Content: Great product. Got for wife as a larger version of her Android phone. Great for long car trips and killing time in the house.

Reviews.Title: Great for simple use
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: It's great for basic use like watching youtube videos as it doesn't heat up easily. However, I've encountered the same problem as some other buyers. 1. The launcher kept failing. I did a factory reset and did not delete any pre-installed app and it was fine after that. 2. The clock might lag at times and the time shown is inaccurate. After restarting the device the clock will be back to normal but it is quite troublesome to keep having to restart it when the time shown is inaccurate.Other than all these, it's still a great device for basic uses :)

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: J. Cutshall
Reviews.Content: It is my favorite Android device yet (out of 6).  Especially good considering the $119 cost when I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Asus 7 in tablet.
Reviews.Author: Lee "Booman"
Reviews.Content: Very first tablet.  Didn't know what to expect.  after getting another 7 in tablet, I really like the Asus because it makes use of the whole screen size for apps and widgets and the bigger issue is it doesn't get warm while charging or using like my Nextbook does.  Have trouble with 32 GB class 10 MicroSD card where it says "SD card removed" and then "SD card found" every 3 seconds.  Doesn't do that to my 8 GB class 4 card for some reason.  That's why it's a 4 star instead of 5 for  me.

Reviews.Title: Price To Performance Winner!
Reviews.Author: Deadeye
Reviews.Content: The price to performance ratio is great with this tablet!  Probably the best performing tablet with the best screen for the $130 price range.  I love that it has a microSD slot.  I have a 32 GB in mine with lots of movies.  Good stuff!

Reviews.Title: Just as good as the Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Great tablet! It is impressively responsive, runs one of the latest android OSes, and has expandable memory.I bought this to replace a broken Nexus 7 (1st gen), and it was well worth the cost. It performs as well as my Nexus 7, and with expandable memory (why does Google think that no micro-sd is a good idea?) it is a better option.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: LOVE PRODUCT GREAT GREAT GREAT, NO REGRETS... PROTECTS WELL. I RECOMMEND IT TO ALL. SO WHY BUY A GALAXY.. I HAVE ONE TOO...

Reviews.Title: Like this tablet a lot.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Tried several inexpensive tablets but did not like them.For a few dollars more the Asus MeMo Pad does everything I want. After a month I have no complaints this tablet is a perfect medium between cost and function.

Reviews.Title: good fit
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Hernandez Galarza
Reviews.Content: Fits fest and does not slippers from my toddler hands. I would just suggest to make it a little more harder

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: D. Holman
Reviews.Content: Brought this tablet for my mom she loves it,it has good battery life a good size for her and it's fast overall I'm happy I made the purchase for her because it was worth the price

Reviews.Title: Prime movies cannot be watched on this
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: After two Kindle HD that stopped working I purchased this as a replacement.Great tablet but only problem is I cannot watch my Prime videos or movies.Not a deal breaker but i wish it was mentioned before I bought it and not have to contact Amazon on why it couldn't be done.Cannot say anything bad about this and it works very well.

Reviews.Title: vey good purchase
Reviews.Author: Hermes Alvarado Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: this tablet is very good, I think I just bought an excellent product, only one thing is missing, the hdmi port.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet, I couldn't ask for more ! It's the best tablet I've ever used.
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ortega Perez "JAOP"
Reviews.Content: Awesome Tablet, I couldn't ask for more ! It's the best tablet I've ever used. The screen resolution is amazing, the color is beautiful for my wife and in general fast, the battery last forever ... so I'm amazed

Reviews.Title: I'm happy I chose this product
Reviews.Author: S. Harvey
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely happy with this tablet so far. Granted, I've only had it for a week. However, this was a replacement for an old tablet of mine that had become almost unusable, and I have continued to be amazed at how far superior my MeMO Pad is to my old tablet in every respect. Superior speed, superior display, superior battery life. In reading these reviews, (other than those who obviously received a lemon), it's clear just how much our past experiences affect our expectations, and how much our expectations affect our satisfaction.UPDATE, December 14, 2013: I've now used this tablet every day for over a month, and I definitely still consider it to be a 5-star product. I recently had the opportunity to compare my MeMO Pad to the 2013 Kindle Fire HD, and the MeMO Pad's processing speed was noticeably faster (and not just by a little).  I now want to do a comparison with the Fire HDX to see which one has the faster processor. If I get the chance, I'll add that comparison to this review. I don't expect my 5-star rating to change, though, no matter the result.

Reviews.Title: Great low-price tablet
Reviews.Author: Williams Family
Reviews.Content: Seems like a great tablet for the low price point.  I don't have anything to compare it with but I haven't had any problems and it is everything I wanted it to be.  Great for simple web-browsing, Netflix, Facebook, apps etc.

Reviews.Title: Loved it.
Reviews.Author: Clarence D Wasson
Reviews.Content: I got my tablet and loved the way it worked.  After 2 days it wouldn't turn on anymore.  I tried everything.  Contacted Amazon and they had me send it back and put a new in the mail right away.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need.
Reviews.Author: NullSig
Reviews.Content: I only needed a portable media device for travel and to watch TV/movies while running at the gym. This does that perfectly. No complaints. I dropped it on hard carpet from about 5 feet and nothing happened. Quite durable.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet...
Reviews.Author: Daniel Stephens
Reviews.Content: This is a good responsive tablet... Has everything you expect in a tablet, though I recommend a browser like Operah to prevent the unit from becoming bogged down when multi-tasking...

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for this price.
Reviews.Author: Umashankar
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet yesterday. I am happy to buy this tablet and it works well.I watched video in youtube and i liked it clarity.Able to read PDF nicely.

Reviews.Title: somethings happened
Reviews.Author: nythawk
Reviews.Content: This tablet worked great for 2 months. Now the magnification and my email programs are having problems. Certain parts of the screen has small postage stamp size zoomed boxes and where the checkboxes to delete emails are in 2 different email programs I use have been replaced by an asian language. I believe it's either Taiwan or Korean and like I said it's where the  check boxes were, not the email itself. Weird. My tablet language I selected is English(United States) and hasn't changed. I'm sure that this is a tablet software problem for both problems because I use the same email programs for my PC and it doesn't do this. Also I have another Asus tablet different model and I don't have the email problem or the zoom problem. I also did the factory reset and it didn't help. Calling Asus support. I'll update what happens.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: It is exactly what I needed. Easy to carry, perfect picture and plenty of memory for what I need it for.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Memo pad 7 inch
Reviews.Author: Maria Fernanda Zapata
Reviews.Content: GREAT ITEM! the only thing I do not like is that the menu does not rotate it is ina fixed position...the rest is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: Irma Cadogan "Dr. Garv. Irma's Son."
Reviews.Content: For the price, it's hard to find a better bang for your buck scenario. I purchased two of these and the work great. I'm not the heaviest, most intense tablet user but I'm also not the lightest user. This device offered great balance of speed, functionality and price. I'll definitely say I've gotten great value for money with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Yecid A. Fontalvo Collante
Reviews.Content: We buy for my dougther...we install apps for moveis and gamesWe need a parental control app....was easy!The size its the correct for 3.5 years old girl.3G option would be nice!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jose Ovidio Rojas Cruz
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fabolous, I bought it for my son.  He is very happy.  the tablet has an excelents  performance and features, I consider that cost is good.

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Good Fit
Reviews.Author: jamiejam
Reviews.Content: Does the job.  Great product.  The fact that you get more than one, gives you chance to mess up once or twice.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: jadastoy
Reviews.Content: The shipping was good , tablet arrived sooner than expected. It took only a few minutes to setup, very easy just follow instructions.Graphics are excellent. Wife likes to use it to read in bed and on long trips. It's not the best in sunlite, you have to remember it's not a reader. If all you want to use it just for reading for buy an E reader. 7" is just the right size for her to put in her purse. Had a problem whit the SD card unmounting, when I put in a case I no longer have the problem. Remember this is a tablet use it for what it is.  I would recommend this. Price is great and unlimited Apps available some good and others not so good. You'll have to try the Apps and dicied you'er self. I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Asus Tablet
Reviews.Author: R. Fuqua
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet as a gift for my 10 yr old daughter, hence the pink color.  She will not put it down.  It is rugged enough to take the abuse that a kid will give it and still work fine.  The battery life is great, lasting several hours every time it is fully charged.  I had a spare memory card that I gave to her so she could save movies and pictures to, so the expansion port was one of the factors that sold me on the tablet.  That tablet includes a charging/ sync cable, micro-usb.  It will also charge from all of my other phone/ tablet cables as well.I would definitely buy this product again, in fact I am planning on buying one for my son as a Christmas gift.  I would suggest getting one of the covers to go along with the tablet.  There are color matched covers available from Asus which fit perfectly.If you are looking for a budget friendly tablet for yourself or as a tablet for a kid, this is one worth considering.

Reviews.Title: This thing is major "Bang for your buck!"
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Brown
