Reviews.Content: This tablet is very much a slightly cheaper build version of the Nexus 7. The tablet has an awesome screen, is very responsive, and has an almost stock Android OS that doesn't have a bunch of unnecessary bloatware. The specs tell you that the SD card slot allows up to 32gb cards but I currently have a 64gb card in mine and it works with no issues.There are just 2 minor complaints I have with the device:1) The screen is a fingerprint magnet... It has an amazing resolution and color reproduction, but you will find yourself cleaning the screen a bit more than most devices.2) The power button is in a slightly odd place. This can be easily resolved by purchasing a TransCover which turns on the device when you open it and also doubles as a stand for watching movies.The 2 issues are bearable considering there is NOTHING comparable at this price point. Nothing comes close unless you wanna spend much more and still not have an expandable memory option.GET ONE!!

Reviews.Title: New Tablet - A Great Value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "MrCTX1"
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMOPad HD7 is a great little tablet for the price.  I was considering several others, with the main contender being the Kindle Fire HD.  This won out because of full Android functionality, SD-card port, and price.  I have not regretted the choice, two weeks in use.  I will update again in a few weeks.Here are the negatives:  Adobe is no longer supporting Flash, so Amazon Prime Instant Videos do not work - I somehow missed that when doing my prelim work.  This might change if Amazon upgrades to HTML5 for its video feeds.  The other negative is the lack of a mini-HDMI port.  While neither of these are huge issues for me, they are important enough for most tablet seekers to warrant the note and the lack of the 5th star.The first sentence really says it - this is a great tablet for the price.  If I could I would rate it 4+.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Paula S "History Buff"
Reviews.Content: Did not want a  Kindle because I have a Nook but love that the Kindle app works great for me on the MeMo. Great size and I have no problems with it at all. In fact I use it much more than my IPad !

Reviews.Title: I love my ASUS MemoPad HD 7-Inch
Reviews.Author: Ms. G.
Reviews.Content: I've only had my ASUS for a short time but so far it is much more than I expected for the price. It's quick and it has loads of apps.  I also find it quite user friendly.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jennem
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that I did not have unreasonable expectations for a tablet selling for only $149 and I am more than happy with what Asus delivered for the price. It does everything I need it to do - browsing, simple games, music, streaming video, Kindle Reader App, etc - and it handles most tasks smoothly enough.Some reviewers mentioned that their micro sd cards unmount randomly, but mine works great. I can access my music directly from the card using the "Play Music" app and the sound is pretty good, especially in "movie mode".The screen is bright and crisp and while I sometimes have to tap it more than once, it is generally responsive. Many online reviewers have complained about the quality and feel of the Memo Pad, but it's really not that bad. I would not even have notice the slight overlap of the back cover if it had not specifically been pointed out to me.Another common complaint is that the power button and volume rocker is in an awkward spot towards the back of the tablet. Actually, when holding the device in your left hand in the portrait position, the volume rocker is positioned perfectly to be reached with the fingers of your left hand, thus leaving your right hand free. It works equally well in the landscape position.The only negative I can think of is that Jelly Bean did not update automatically on my device to the 4.2.2 version for me yet and I am not sure how to fix this.All in all this is a very good product and the shipping from Amazon was super fast!

Reviews.Title: impressed
Reviews.Author: GTR
Reviews.Content: i own several ipads and minis, love them.ive bought the original nexus 7 and more recently a galaxy tab 2 7" - was not impressed with either relative to the ipads.all these devices seem like science fiction miracles to me, so "not impressed" is only relative to ipad standards.the memopad 7 hd arrived yesterday, and i'm very impressed!  fast performance, clear crisp screen, and android 4.2 right out of the box.  for $149 a very good value in my opinion, and viable alternative to a mini on many counts.

Reviews.Title: just love this asus table
Reviews.Author: carribbean girl
Reviews.Content: this is my first tablet and im loving every second of it. it fast and reliable and connect to WiFi very quickly. the tablet does not feel cheap to me at all. Have no problem with this item at all.

Reviews.Title: Personal Use
Reviews.Author: anthony mcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Handy little tablet, makes ease for reading headlines and notes. Books may come later, but for now the convenience of emails and news is great.

Reviews.Title: Decent performance and low price
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: ASUS Memo Pad, is targeted mainly at the low end market. With the price point of 129 for an 8gb model and 149 for the 16gb model. Which is drastically cheaper than the original Nexus 7 and the new Nexus 7. ASUS did cut the corners in all the right places in order to cheap down the cost. On the screen we have 1280x800 panel very similar to the Nexus 7 but you are not going to get that laminated look. It washes out a little easier at different angles and has an appreciable gap on the side. So it is a lower quality display but for the price it is not that bad. On the inside we have a ASUS quad core A7 1gb of ram. The performance seems snappy with Android 4.1. There are quick launch apps on the home screen with different options to launch Google now or Gmail.  So for the price 129-149 is hard to complain, it performs above that price class. It hard to recommend over the original Nexus 7 which has dip down in price if you can find one. Compare Memo Pad with other low end tablet this is the best way to go in the budget class.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: JayE
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a birthday gift for our daughter and she loves the tablet. Very easy to set up. Very responsive. Really easy to navigate. The camera is one of the best feature that our daughter likes the most. I would definitely recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: A great Android tablet, and economic too...
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: A very good purchase. I use the tablet daily, and I'm satisfied that for my surfing, email, limited online poker playing I chose well. My experience so far regarding battery life, between 6-8hrs per charge. I recommend this tablet without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: This is Great. I bought this for my dad and you will get very good product for small price.The software is good and the battery works fro almost 10 hours.I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Cable Dog
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife (pretty pink). Have used it myself (the pink helping me to get in touch with my feminine side). Wife is satisfied. I am very satisfied. Good price. Happy wife.  An old married man could not ask for anything more. This old IT tech believes it is a good piece of technology.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Mandy Payne "Is it just me?"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the high quality of this little, inexpensive tablet. Our house has two iPads, a Samsung Tab 3 10.1 and a Blackberry Playbook. This tablet isn't as cool as the iPads, and it is not as sturdy as the Playbook, but it really does hold its own in most areas.This is a great little tablet for a child to young adult or for the budget conscious. Streaming videos works well. the sound is better than i expected. It works great, has micro sd for added memory (which beats the he** out of iPad) and seems to be a very good purchase. I use mine for travel in case I leave for forget it somewhere, at least it isn't a huge financial blow.Recommended

Reviews.Title: Asus' best kept secret.  Phenomenal 7in android tablet
Reviews.Author: DEAN St Hill
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 7in tablet for my daughter and after lots of research I decided on this. Everything is to love about this tablet - I got a hot pink for my daughter and she loves it. The screen is wonderful. Bright. High definition. Sound equally good. The tablet is no sloth with its quad core processor powering it through every app I threw at it.Its 16g of memory is good and its enhanced through a micro-sd slot. It does justice to multi media of all types with HD movies looking outstanding.Wifi seems to work nicely and I see access points I don't see on other devices.I'll be looking at Asus for future products and already have eyes on the 10 inch Asus Memo Pad FHD which also looks to be a great tablet.This tablet is not without flaws. I am not clear whether USB on the go is supported and it would have been nice to have an hdmi output but then its a sub $150 tablet.Bottom line: Asus has a winner and this should do well as its a great device for its price and maybe still a great bargain if it cost 50 bucks more.

Reviews.Title: just right for the price
Reviews.Author: Earthgirl
Reviews.Content: Amazon send another one  to replace the first and it came fast fedex the next day, They were very helpfull. I would consider getting another. perfect for the kids and so far no problems with this one. Get them protected. just plastic backing. but internally well rounded good quality.

Reviews.Title: great value for your money
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the wife as a gift, and just recently got a chance to play around with it. I currently have a samsung galaxy tab and my baby is my nexus 7 (2012). first off I'd have to say I was impressed almost immediately once I started scrolling through her screens, this thing is snappy. running on android 4.2.1 right out of the box. the memo pad hd7 ran very fluid, and the screen really popped. I immediately had to watch some videos on netflix to compare and petty much as most reviews state both the picture and audio was quite impressive. neither of us are hard core gamers but we both play a lot of casual games so of course I had to try "angry birds star wars", and just for the hell of it "temple run 2" both ran perfect, no stuttering or lag. I took a few pictures and from what I know of tablet cameras, it seemed pretty good. As far as build quality goes, our HD7 is actually pretty solid, I see a lot of reviews knocking the plasticy feel and creekiness. I don't know, maybe its a little bit of hit and miss in that department. my N7 definitely feels more solid, but overall it wouldn't be anything that would stop me from buying. I would highly recommend for anyone looking for a sub $200 tablet. it's made by ASUS the people who made the nexus 7 so that alone should give you a piece of mind. I'd say this little guy is about right on par with the 2012 N7, if not maybe a half step up.

Reviews.Title: very good for the price, a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: DeadlyGalaxy
Reviews.Content: Bought a blue ASUS MeMOPad HD 7 to replace a IPad 2.  At first was a bit hesitant because I'd never used Android OS before, but with $150-$200+ difference between this and a IPad 3/4, decided to give this a try, especially after reading overwhelming positive reviews both here and on tech sites.Got it last week, my impressions so far is, for the price it's a excellent tablet.  It doesn't have some of the high end functions that more expensive tablets have, like mini HDMI or camera flash, but small grips on the whole.  And the housing seems to be a bit less durable than other tablets (IPad), but easily fixed with a nice protective case/cover.  Also the Google Play store isn't as robust in offerings as the Apple AppStore at the moment, but quickly catching up.It's got a nice, easy to use operating system (especially after it updated OS version), tablet screen itself is nice (not quite as sharp as with the Retina IPads or higher end tablets, but still quite nice) and responsive (i'm sure in no small reason of the x4 cores), screen itself seems to be quite responsive to finger tapping and dragging. Memory and slowdowns don't seem to be a problem, and even though it only has 16 gigs of storage memory onboard, it's easily enough fixed with a 32 gig micro sd card ($20-25 here on Amazon) and have read that you can use even higher sized micro SD cards, once formatted properly.So far it's done quite well, main uses are for Facebook, light web usage, picture album and some games here and there.  Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a cheaper/starter tablet without sacrificing performance and build.  I've had several ASUS products in the past and have been very pleased with their quality and price, will definitely consider them again in the future for upgrade/replacement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent budget tablet.
Reviews.Author: Max Harry Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a family member so I only get the privilege of setting it up and playing with it a little.Screen:The MemoPad have a nicer screen than the original (2012) Nexus 7 despite similar resolution. Fonts are 'sharp' and colors are very vibrant. Screen angle is good. HD videos will look very nice on it. Asus included an app called "Splendid" which allows you to control the hue, saturation and temperature of the display, a very nice touch.Build:The device is light and easy to hold with one hand for a prolonged period, good for reading on bed. It's probably not a durable tablet and the screen is not made of Gorilla glass so buying a case and screen protector to avoid scratches is a must.Usage:This tablet is ideal for web browsing, ebook, video chat, and especially watching videos and streaming. The processor should be adequate for all these tasks with few stutters. However, it's highly recommended to speed up the device by installing a third party launcher and disabling built-in apps you don't need. It's GPS actually gets good signal and can get a location fix in a short time so it could be ideal for offline maps. With support of microSD card you can load in a lot of media. It will struggle for realistic 3D games. It was very choppy with Asphalt 7, but general popular games like Temple Run, etc is no problem.I can't confirm the battery life, but the general consensus seems that the MediaTek processor in this tablet is energy efficient which warrant Asus's claim of 10hours battery life. This may coincide with the device staying cool. It does get warm on the top half of the tablet for intensive tasks, but not too uncomfortable.Comparing to the Nexus 7: Comparing to the original (2012) Nexus 7, this MemoPad have a better screen, slightly better speaker I think, rear camera, microSD slot, longer battery life, but somewhat lower performance. However, if you can spend more money, the newer generation Nexus 7 is going to be a much better choice since its at least twice faster and have a rear camera as well. However, Nexus devices never gets microSD slot which can be a minus, this is the primary reason why the person I bought this tablet for wanted it instead of the Nexus 7.A nice bonus, they included a cheap tablet stand in the box.Update: It seems the 4.2.1 firmware of this device it experienced incompatibility issues with a few games, but only a tiny few so I wouldn't be worried. The games that crashed when I tried to run are Fruit Ninja, Let's Golf 3 and Flow. Most other popular games work without problems. I'm sure Asus will fix this in their future updates.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for the wife...Powerful for the price
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: I bought this in the "pink" model for my wife as she was often asking to borrow my tablet around the house. For 150 bucks, this is a heck of a tablet for only a 7" model. I bought my Acer A700 when they first hit shelves for around 350 bucks and while it is a dual core with the same specs as this 7", after getting this tablet setup for my wife I could tell the difference between the processing speed from my A700 versus this Memo Pad HD. I liked the few hours setting this tablet up so much I'm considering purchasing the 10 inch model for myself as a replacement to mine.PROS:Lightweight (really light honestly)Fast Processing timesSelectable screen freeze instead of an external buttonDual Cams (both have zoom options too)CONS:Works better with a stylus (the one that comes with the Roo Cases works wonders, not too accurate with "finger" touches for certain applications)Screen switching is too sensitive when on (doesn't take much for the screen to flip direction)Load times claim 10 secs or less, it's more like 15 secs average (or like a Win OS on a SSD)Slick surfaces (doesn't have a rubberized skin or something that feel "grippy")

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing...
Reviews.Author: Ann Rhodes
Reviews.Content: Once again Asus has given me a tablet that I absolutely adore. I purchased it for on the go reading because I didn't like the "front page "  of the kindle fire, but I am so tempted to start loading everything.I actually use it at its lowest brightness setting because it't really bright.

Reviews.Title: Nice device...
Reviews.Author: ENDER
Reviews.Content: Excellent display (1280x800) and large memory (16GB) with the fast CPU (1.2GHz). Compared to the other brand tablets, these are advantages. I'm fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Billy Godwin
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. On have complaint and that is the tablet is hard to unlock and is a bit slow when unlocking. Otherwise its great.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Randall Bancroft
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a week. Replacing my old Nook Color (which I still love). Great screen, light weight, quick, lots of apps to get you started. Battery lasts. People may complain about finger prints but really... not worse or better than other tablets. Very comfortable to hold - which I love. I plan on buying another.

Reviews.Title: Returning it ASAP
Reviews.Author: eoneill "Ed"
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 10 days. I really liked it, except it died today. Been on the charger all day, nothing changes.  Talked to tech support, they didn't have much to offer besides (send it in for repairs).  Being less than 2 weeks old, this will be returned and I will go with something else. I used it for less than 6 hours total and it is dead!I have had great other experiences with ASUS, but this is a POS.

Reviews.Title: Everything you want in a device at this price point
Reviews.Author: William R. Russell "Rick"
Reviews.Content: I've been buying original-style Kindle Fires for my kids. I wanted something similar, but with full Google app capabilities and expandable storage.The new ASUS MeMOPad HD fits the bill. I can drop a 16GB or 32GB card in there and turn it into a movie machine or a downloading node, then easily transfer the data to my computer without messing about with the terrible MTP mode. CPU power, RAM & general performance are all adequate for the types of apps that you'll be running on a 7-inch tablet. I've been playing full 3D games like Carmageddon and GTA: Vice City at 1280x720 with absolutely no performance problems. The display is fantastic with no color distortion at odd angles.Minor nits: Lack of any vibration was a surprise; I guess after using Android on phones for so long, I just expect it. Also, the speakers could be better. ASUS makes a big deal out of the audio quality, but it's just marketing. It's the same flat, tinny, no-stereo-separation speaker you'd get with any tablet. The color screen washes out in direct sunlight, again no real surprise for any device with a backlit display.Overall, the MeMOPad HD is a good tablet but a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Fusiturns
Reviews.Content: Likes:$150Screen looks greatSD slotBattery lifeNot an Apple, Samsung or a pure Google product.Cons:Screen a finger print magnetEven though it’s not as smooth as some as the big name products, you can’t beat this product for $150 and all it features.

Reviews.Title: BEST Bargain Priced Tab Available NOW  11/9/2013
Reviews.Author: J. D. Patterson
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet; the BEST value in a serious tablet available NOW - 11.9.2013.No if's, and's or rebuttals.The next best SERIOUS fully-featured tab will run you another hundred bucks. Maybe more.As a bonus, ASUS support is very good to excellent.Do your research and you WILL buy this tablet.Period.Update 11.10.2013CNET did not like this tab very much in their 7.26.2013 review and I take exception to many of their comments. They did opine that the Android OS update to 4.2.2 might improve slow performance and it sure did IF the performance was slow to begin with (which I contend it was NOT).This tab is not slow, does not lag, is not hard to hold (get a case like everyone does), is not a lackluster design (is actually a Nexus clone) and does have above average sound (in both controls and quality).The OS update was performed with ease and if you are a new owner, do this update as soon as the battery has received its first full charge.This IS INDEED a great tab for the bucks and I am not sure why CNET was so harsh, and IMO, off base.I have since added a 32GB Class 10 Micro SD card, a nifty case, and a screen protector.And I stick by my guns.This tab rocks.UPDATE  11.30.2013Still pleases and amazes. Since I made this purchase a number of "cheap" tablets are now on the market, screaming insistently, "buy me, buy ME".. However, if in the market, do your research and COMPARE, because less is not always more.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Luis Felipe Chavarria Mora
Reviews.Content: I bought it because I had high expectations of hard working asus alone two months and try to communicate with the asus repair service are incompetent and, worst service I have ever received in my life. Final story a tablet that does not work and 140 dollars in the trash. I do not buy really be disappointed with the quality of this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Asus makes junk
Reviews.Author: SitkaCMark
Reviews.Content: 1. SD card constantly unmounts/remounts2. Random power-off/power-on3. Asus will not honor their warranty: purchased in January 2014, contacted Asus for warranty service March 2014. I live on my sailboat in Alaska and was told they would do nothing for me since I do not have a street address (I do have a PO box)This tablet isn't worth the cardboard box it came shipped in. Asus is not only a pretender, they fail to keep their word.

Reviews.Title: Good until it stops working
Reviews.Author: Mr Chris
Reviews.Content: Was great but unfortunately lasted only 9 weeks before it turned into a paperweight. Wont turn on. Do a search for 'My ASUS MemoPad HD7 wont turn on' and you'll see that this is a big big problem with these devices.On top of that there is no way of getting a service case made via the ASUS website as they will not let you submit a case unless you have the serial number of the device. The serial number of an Android device can only be found by turning the unit on..Amazon wont swap the unit as its past the 30 days, ASUS wont open a repair case as I cannot retrieve the serial number.So far as expensive paperweights go this one works well. Holds down multiple papers in even the strongest winds eventually the slippy plastic back causes the papers to come free. Next time I'm buying paperweights from ASUS I'll get one with a rubbery back that holds paper down a little better.

Reviews.Title: Asus memopad
Reviews.Author: Deborah Nelson
Reviews.Content: Love it when we first got the product.  Only had three months and the touch screen stopped working.  No the best deal for the money and have not found any way to fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Bought two, both broken within 3 months!
Reviews.Author: Kelley A. Abella
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, one for each of my middle schoolers to use at school. One of them has worked well but the other broke within the first 3 months. The touch screen became unresponsive despite any efforts to reboot or reset the device. I sent it in for repairs and was sent back the device in good working order... for about 1 month then the same problem occurred. I decided to just buy my son a new one since this one was obviously a dud. (After all, my other son's tablet is still working fine.) We received the new tablet but it broke within a couple of months, also. Completely unresponsive. I decided to just cut my losses and go with a different brand altogether. You may get lucky and get a tablet that works but I wouldn't risk it if I were you.

Reviews.Title: Best 7 inch tab with great power management
Reviews.Author: Karthik
Reviews.Content: I love the Asus Memo pad.. its best return for <$130.. I am able to use it with WiFi for more than 10hrs.. It has GPS, 5MP camera and a decent touch... this is worth for what you pay..

Reviews.Title: best tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: carla
Reviews.Content: I feel smart just because I bought this tablet! It has everything I wanted for a price that didn't make me feel used.  The camera works well, I watch my netflix, Skype easily, plenty of space for bunches of aps, GPS, I'm in love. Asus has my product loyalty behind this one.

Reviews.Title: exellent
Reviews.Author: ennis poota
Reviews.Content: Best tablet for the price, and don't let the price fool you, it is a great product, battery last long time.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Luvparis
Reviews.Content: Great tablet I purchased thus for my dons birthday. I've been using it and find that it functions very well and is a great product for the price I'm thinking sboyt purchasing another

Reviews.Title: Was great until it died prematurely
Reviews.Author: Beri Cohen
Reviews.Content: Capable tablet, good speed, great screen, good touch sensitivity especially with the supplied stylus.  Bought in November 2013, Died in May 2014 although was handled gently.  Not happy.

Reviews.Title: Good value!
Reviews.Author: Shannon R Windham
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my young teen. It has everything he needs and he's enjoyed it. Best value for the quality!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Ignatius
Reviews.Content: I own the tablet for about 8 months now.It is a great product, strong, durable, and portable. It allows me to bring it everywhere without worrying of it being too "heavy".I must admit that this tablet is faster than what I have expected in speed processing wise, and I'm very happy with it.The screen however, you must take care of it very carefully.I once accidentally pressed on it too hard, and then the screen or the "digitizer" no longer responds to my fingerprints. Only the undamaged side of the screen still works. I sent it in to ASUS, they fixed it, and it's all back to normal. Despite to this incident, I am very happy with what this tablet can provide me with. To be honest, I find this tablet more useful, and has so much more compare to an iPad (Nothing against it). I highly recommend this to you all tablet users, whether experienced, or new tablet users.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Michael and Rodline Mackey
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying using this tablet. It is my first tablet, but it was easy to learn to use. But no 5 stars because I had battery charging issues one week later. I had to trickle charge it via the computer USB port in order to use the electrical outlet charger. From time to time, the battery acts up, but I know what to do now, still it's not a perfect tablet.

Reviews.Title: LOVE!
Reviews.Author: Morgan Rhodes
Reviews.Content: My mom LOVES her tablet. I got it for her for Mother's Day & she loves everything about it. I purchased one for my boyfriend as well for his birthday coming up :]

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet, White (ME173X-A1-WH) Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Franklin Montes
Reviews.Content: A good tablet.My tablet it has a screen details inside you can see a blank line, I have using for two weeks and it's ok the line is there but not problem about it.Pro:-You get what you paid.-It's a good tablet for beginner.-Battery is good with videos I saw 3 hours videos and from 100% goes to 70%.Cons:-Cheaper Material, but please for 130$ it's fine.-Is slow when multitasking (but come on is a tablet not a laptop it's fine).-Some new games are not supported and won't work Example Injustice Gods Amoung Us (work fine on my Moto G).Is a good tablet for beginners, I am using with my baby 2yrs old and for the price it's fine. Need an update to Android (4.2.2 Jelly Bean)Asus made a good work but there are a lot of few details.

Reviews.Title: Worked well at first
Reviews.Author: Charles McGuire
Reviews.Content: Once I received the tablet, it was everything I expected.  Very easy to  use, lots of memory and perfect size.  Less than a month old, it would not power on and I had to return it on my dime to the ASUS factory for them to fix.  You would think they would send you out a new one rather trying to fix the old one.  I hear this is a very common problem with this tablet.  I would not purchase this brand again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Indika Kularatne
Reviews.Content: After searching  for more than one month finally I decided to buy ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB tablet. It was an excellent choice and the tab is working fine w/o any issues. battery life is amazing and I can run any games on it. display, color, performance is excellent. Good deal for less than $150

Reviews.Title: All about tradeoff between quality and price
Reviews.Author: Javad Rahimipour Anaraki
Reviews.Content: ASUS MeMOPad HD is a nice tablet with good quality and the most important reasonable price.The screen resolution and sound quality is very good but you will find minor lags in some applications; however, the overall performance is good.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: P. Hill
Reviews.Content: For the money, this tablet does a lot.  So far, I have not learned all the functions but it is pretty friendly.  Easy to tote around.  The camera is best for stationary or slow moving objects.

Reviews.Title: I like it but....
Reviews.Author: Techy A.
Reviews.Content: I always like Asus products. It is priced reasonably and with reasonable quality.This tablet has a huge potential to be a great one if Asus does not modify the Android OS so much.The launcher crash happened right after I got it. Every time you hit the home key, the launcher crashes.It seems to be a common problem for MeMOPad HD 7. The solution is to install third party launcher from Google Play store or do a factory reset.I really want to make the Asus launcher work since it seems to be a pretty nice interface. However, even with latest update I still have this problem. I think it is about time for Asus to beef up customer supports on their website and get their acts together.

Reviews.Title: Asus Memopad
Reviews.Author: patty leavins
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a good for a first time device, especially for kids. Be sure to get the protection warranty if it is for a child. My two kids taught themselves to use them with very little help from me.

Reviews.Title: Great pad for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Baker
Reviews.Content: The wife uses it for quick checks for email and web browsing. Easy to carry around and just the right size.

Reviews.Title: A great new toy!
Reviews.Author: S. Lee "waterwoman39"
Reviews.Content: I've been trying out and lusting after family and friends tablets for a year.  A bit of a technology junkie, I have 2 workable pc laptops and 2 MacBooks.  Then my daughter's tablet was stolen and it was her main communication tool for an extended European vacation of 9 months.  I started helping her select a replacement and got hooked on tablets  a second time.  Her decision was limited somewhat by her location but she had a pretty good selection.  When she got home though she was complaining about how slow it was and I remembered a few I had checked for her, Asus being a Company I favor, I saw prices dropping and had to get one of my own.  I'm so to getting it set up for my purposes, but the things I like best are the battery life and the speed of response.  I haven't used the front and rear cameras much and I see them as something that would be really nice for phone chats with my far flung family.  Too bad the family won't cooperate.  The size is more comfortable for me than my larger 8.9 tablet which is a nicer reader, but reading on it is quite acceptable.  This was a really good Amazon deal!

Reviews.Title: Weak Screen
Reviews.Author: Alex Dove
Reviews.Content: The screen cracks easily fell 1 foot and hit my charger with a plastic case. Broke terribly, well the screen did.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MemoPad
Reviews.Author: John H. Robertson "Hotepjh"
Reviews.Content: Still a little early but this ASUS MemoPad works great!  It's fast the graphics are very clear and the battery life is very good and reliable.

Reviews.Title: Broke within 3 months
Reviews.Author: G. Jean "Lover of books"
Reviews.Content: Came worked fine for 2 months then some of the screen went dead. Sent back to Asus for repair in early March, did not receive until Thursday (5/15/14). Now it will not boot up. Just tired of this

Reviews.Title: CAREFUL HANDLING!!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Harrison "The Midgard Knight"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing, especially for the price. I love how easy it is to use and how clear everything looks. It definitely doesn't seem to process as fast as other tablets, especially when downloading a ton of apps, but it's still a great buy.CAUTION HOWEVER: If you basically grab the tablet anywhere near the SD card, even touching near the insertion point, you might mount and unmount the card. It happened to me and deleted everything off of the SD card. Really sucks, because otherwise I'd give this a 5/5 rating.

Reviews.Title: Good while it worked
Reviews.Author: landlocked surfer girls
Reviews.Content: My partner loved this little tablet for 2 days..then. Clicked the button to wake it up on 3rd day, whole screen was a mess of crossed digital lines with dead spots.  Not sure if this was due to it being a refurbished item or if this is common.  I am returning to amazon for refund.  Sigh.....

Reviews.Title: Hard to
Reviews.Author: Dean Bailey
Reviews.Content: turn off and on.  Otherwise, we are pretty happy with it. I would buy one again if I needed another tablet.

Reviews.Title: 9 months and going
Reviews.Author: LA, the state.
Reviews.Content: Battery life is still good, Easy to use. Cannot beat even with a tablet at twice the cost. I am getting another for my wife, maybe she will let me use mine.

Reviews.Title: I love this device
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: i am joy for this computer, because this are fast, saleem and  comfortable for everything. I recommendation this computer if you want to have good  helper in your life.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Price to Performance Tablet with good Apps.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Price for tablet specifications are very good.  Item shipped on time. Device arrived on time with expedited shipping payment. Third exact device purchased to replace insured damaged unit 9 months later. Slight difficulty updating android OS to 4.2.2 but ASUS tech support did help even though the email communication was in Tiawan. Tech Support did resolve the issue with my serial number and now the tablet is updated and working great.  Insured again with "Square Trade" Accident Protection Plan.  Parental Controls are straigh-forward and easy to setup.  Pleased with purchase and would reccommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Kendra
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it....very inexpensive and works great.  She loves the smaller size also easier to handle.  Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: Good unit at $149
Reviews.Author: lm6000
Reviews.Content: Short of having to hold the power button in a little long to power up occasionly it works well. People have commented that the glass is not as smooth to glide, I agree. I have a Samsung Tab 2 7" the Asus specs better but to me it's a toss up. Although I paid more for the Tab 2, if the same price $ 149 I would buy the Asus, they both have 2 cameras and can Skype.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value and Size
Reviews.Author: Megan L Fullerton
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these, one for myself and one for my boyfriend.  His arrived in perfect condition and he started using it right away.  He uses it a lot for his college work, finding free database apps and other information for his geology classes.  Mine came with a very scuffed up screen, and I sent it back for a replacement.  The replacement came quickly and was in perfect condition.  It feels very sturdy, though as with all touch screen devices I would suggest a screen protector and case, which I also purchased for both tablets.  I did have a problem with the screen on mine suddenly starting to flicker, turning it off and on did not help.  After quick research I found it was likely a firmware update, and a factory reset followed by 2 hours of off-time fixed it right up.  I very much love these tablets and for the money you pay you get a good product, maybe not the best out there but amazing for the price.  It's been more than worth the few glitches here and there, because let's be honest no technology is entirely hassle free.

Reviews.Title: Works awesome!  Easy to remove the ASUS ROM
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to remove the silly asus menu and have regular android.  It is awesome to have 2 cameras!  I love having an SD card to put music on.  Great device!

Reviews.Title: easily broken digitizer
Reviews.Author: Darleneh
Reviews.Content: I have had a few tables, for myself and my grandkids. Of these 2 were Asus. Both immediately had broken digitizers. Be careful the slightest bump breaks them. Even in a case. The last one I only had 2 weeks. Other brands seem to hold up a lot better.  200.00 down the tube.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my wife to play with...great item for price
Reviews.Author: Queensryche
Reviews.Content: Great item.  Works just like it's supposed to.  Arrived in mint condition.  Would order another or recommend to a friend who was looking for one.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: S. D. Herren "TxClubOwner"
Reviews.Content: It's not fabulous, it's good.  I like the screen, the brightness and resolution.  I hate that I can't play netflix or watch amazon prime videos on this device.  I dislike the lack of accessories.  I can only find cases online, and not one that I really wanted.  No electronics store that I've visited here in Houston has a screen protector, I suppose I could order one online.  I wanted an Android operating system, so I replaced my kindle fire with this, reasoning that I could use the kindle app on here and have the best of both worlds.  That was a mistake.  This isn't bad by any means, but I've decided to go back to my phone for android apps that I just must have, and back to a kindle for reading and movies on the go.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it!
Reviews.Author: Eric Abbiss
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a small tablet.  We have moved on to Samsung 10.2 Tab 3's now, but this still sees use.  Fast, and small enough to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: juan manuel
Reviews.Content: Regrettably mi table had a defect, i had  to return, but is very fast, the photos are expectacular, only have 5 megapixels, but i think that have more definition than others with more megapixels. if had a flash in the camera were sensational. the others improvements should be in clockwise .I expect that test this devices because i lost money in the return.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, But.....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Good: Super nice display, very fast when compared to other 7 inch android tablets. Rarely ever has any hangups unless it's also auto updating apps, which you can disable that through Google Play. Has a micro SD car slot. Has a great outer camera at 5.0 mega pixels. Which is great for a tablet. Speaker quality is good. I bought 4 of these tablets, 3 in blue and 1 in green for my children.The Bad: Out of the 4 tablets I have bought so far. One of them the touch screen stopped working. Still was able to turn it on with no problem, but couldn't unlock the screen. I called Asus and they had me do a factory reset hoping it would fix the problem. Factory reset did NOT work. Screen was still not responding to touch.This happens to be a known issue by the way. I was going to do an RMA, however Asus won't honor their warranty even with a manufacturer defect if there are any scratches or marks of any kind on the tablet. The tablet has never been dropped and has been in a protective case since day 1. However since my son's name was put on it on the back so he knew it was his without turning it on (3 of the same tablet color) they said it was abused. At least I purchased an extended drops and spills warranty so they covered it. I sent them the tablet and received a gift card for the price that I paid for it.I'm debating weather or not to purchase another Asus Memo Pad tablet for my son since their customer service is terrible and they won't honor manufacturer defects. My son loved that tablet and took good care of it. He didn't cause the touch screen to malfunction and stop working. So buyer beware if the newer tablets still have the same manufacturer defect. My kids and I are keeping a close eye on the remaining 3 tablets to see if there are signs that it will do the same thing.Warning Signs That The Touch Screen Will Stop Working: Touch screen starts to act funny, like a ghost is touching the screen by moving characters during game play on it's own without user input. Touch screen randomly stops responding to all touches intermittently. This is what my son's did for 2 days before it stopped functioning all together.

Reviews.Title: Telescope Control
Reviews.Author: W. Thomas "WAN guy"
Reviews.Content: Bought to use with SkySafari using Bluetooth to provide GoTo and tracking for large telescopes.  The Asus is used next to the eyepiece and displays a star chart where the scope is pointed.

Reviews.Title: Better than Nexus
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom for her birthday and I like it more than my Nexus 7 (1st gen). It's fast, has lots of fun apps (including a camera mirror app so she can check her makeup with it) and the volume is great for watching movies. Thinking about getting another and regifting my Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Met all my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Mike B @ Phoenix
Reviews.Content: It was exactly as I expected and included the charger.  Despite the fact that I wish the camera capability were a bit more powerful, I'm very happy with the overall performance of the ASUS tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brenda Johnson
Reviews.Content: Everything about it is exactly what we wanted!  We have been using it about a month with no issues. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: So far So Good
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: Im not a power user , just wanted a entry level tablet to surf , run a couple of mapping apps and let my kids play games on . I bought my son a Dell Venue 7 on sell at the same time for a bit less so thats the only other tablet I have experience with . The Asus has better cameras than the dell and feels a little bit more rubust over the dell . A few Apps seem to load a little faster on the Dell over the Asus when my daughter and son are both playing on them . I use it in my work van during lunch break to surf or read ,at night my 2 year old takes it to play games on it and I use it on my dual sport motorcycle weekly to do trail mapping work. I have it in a cheap soft cover and it has took the abuse fine so far from me and my 2 year old . The GPS works good enough for my trail mapping and close enough to geocache with but I still carry my garmin 60csx to get in a little more accurate coordinates when needed . I charge it a couple times a week normally , sometimes more if I have done a bit of mapping or if the kids have been playing on it ......... Or I start a game of survival craft .Over all Im very happy with it and wish I would have got my son the asus instead of the dell .

Reviews.Title: New tablet for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel Petrosky
Reviews.Content: For 150 dollars I think this is a great tablet, added a 32GB micro sd right out of the box. Downloaded a parental lock and my child couldn't be happier. Asus makes a great product, this is my second tablet and I have a net book.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Stovall "Monarch"
Reviews.Content: Not quite the Nexus 7, but for almost half the price, it's better than the Nexus 7.  Excellent screen resolution. Good battery life, unless you forget to turn off WiFi when not using it. Not too bulky. Could use an HDMI out and bluetooth, but knew it wasn't there when purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Cannot imagine anything nicer
Reviews.Author: Bakken
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to a 60-year old female and she loves it.  It is fast and is easy to use. The display is bright and we have no issues.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Hristo Malchev
Reviews.Content: Screen is bright, touch functions sensitive, processor fast, smooth scrolling through pages, apps as good as Android gets, very thin and light, nice design, great battery life, fine cameras... - pretty much anything you could expect from a smaller tablet. To those looking to pay more for a Samsung - think twice. To those looking at cheaper stuff - not worth it if you value your time and nerves at all (I tried two different ones and gave up).

Reviews.Title: perfect for our needs
Reviews.Author: Beverly Burrell
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet. Fast processor. Does exactly what I need. I read and study a lot. Supports all the apps I need for such activities. Also, supports apps for my young child. Amazing value.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: spl42
Reviews.Content: This is my first Tablet. I bought it for one main purpose and that's to use as my Dslr monitor.  The resolution is really good and moves between screens well. I've watched some of my flixster on this and very nice good sound.Haven't used as monitor yet waiting on adapter. I was amazed how well battery last if you don't use it a lot. I had it on for three days with light usage before recharging'

Reviews.Title: Love this
Reviews.Author: Kellie S. Lively
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet! Responds very well to touch and holds a charge forever! Great pic and def worth the money! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Premium isn't expensive anymore
Reviews.Author: Anonynja
Reviews.Content: Helluva capable tablet. It just does everything well! Such a pleasant surprise in technology- no nuisances to speak of. I only use it lightly, so I won't attest to its durability, but usability is simply great. Frankly, I feel spoiled for being a child of this generation, with a relatively cheap device that does.. so.. much. Movies, games, browsing, navigating, music, organizing, corresponding, pictures, you know the drill. Companies don't even bothering listing all the features and programs tablets come with, haha. My point is that this tablet handles *all* of them. The hardware is perfectly adequate; I've experienced no lag in any setting.And the size is just perfect! I love reading with it, and it's big enough to watch a movie on the bus or whatever, yet compact enough to comfortably hold in one hand and fit into any bag. 7" is such a sweet spot, though it ain't much of a drawing surface (unless you usually draw in little notepads for some reason).I just want to emphasize that i have *no complaints* with this tablet whatsoever. None. Now I'm pretty zen and not particularly picky, but seriously, nothing about the memopad annoys me. It has so far simply been a positive addition to my life. I'll end on that note :)

Reviews.Title: Carry It Everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Puff Kitty
Reviews.Content: This little ASUS MeMO is great.  The colors, the definition - fine!  The camera is good, surprise!  It is easy to use as a calendar, the Kindle android app works great on it, easier than on the paperwhite kindle (it even looks as good as the Fire to me). The speakers are tinny, but of course you can add a speaker via the USB and earphone ports.  Music sounds good enough to enjoy and audio books too.  Am not a gamer so cannot speak to that.  It is easy to navigate, which is the most important.  Bought a Roo Case for it which protects the screen since it did NOT come with a plastic screen protector like you would expect! Listen up, ASUS people!  After almost six months, my only complaint is that the battery runs down quickly, moreso than when new.  If you are on the Internet, it is sapped within a few hours.  If you are just reading, maybe it will last a day.  It now needs to be plugged in each night.  Would be interesting to know if other owners of this device are experiencing the same thing.  Over all, I am satisfied w/ the tablet and the price.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable value and performance for an entry level "REAL" tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on sale for my eleven year old back in November 2013 for $119.xx and couldn't be happier with the purchase!  Very durable, fluid, powerful for the price, etc...  Looked at SOOOOO many tablets before making this decision.  EVERYTHING cheaper was just that...terrible screen, slow processing ability, no sd slot, on and on...  Anything that was even CLOSE the regular price of this tablet ($149.xx) couldn't match it's performance specs.  Nexus was closest and considerably more expensive.  Samsung Tab 3 was decently more expensive but couldn't touch the power of this tab in direct side-by-side comparison at local stores.Again, very pleased!!!  So much, in fact, that Santa brought his nine year old sister one for X-mas and, of course, she loves it too!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: wanda ingram
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and the Asus had good reviews so I bought it. For the $150 price its a pretty good tablet. The only complaint I have is it doesnt take great pictures on the inside but very good pictures on the outside. The body is very durable and not cheap looking. I wish the volume was a little louder for Pandora but I guess I need a stereo if I want loud music..Im satisfied with my purchse!

Reviews.Title: So far so good... Edited 4/29/2013--UGH
Reviews.Author: Mama of 4
Reviews.Content: ***Edited 4/29/14: Well, I had a feeling this would happen. We now are sending out the second tablet we purchased. The keypad function suddenly stopped working. These tablets are well taken care of. They are screen and tablet protected completely and my sons are monitored in their usage of them. I am beside myself that both of these tablets after only four months of usage needed to be serviced already. That is absurd. I have a feeling this will be happening again. I'm happy that the company is willing to fix the issue, but to have to pay to ship to them, then my sons losing all of their info and games and such, it's just quite a pain to deal with this. Why can't they just work properly? I find it hard to believe that these are solid, well built tablets when in purchasing two of them, I've already needed them BOTH serviced after such a short period of use. I'm staring to believe they are junk tablets. Yea, the price wasn't $300 but we did pay $129 for each tablet and for a family on a budget, that isn't cheap to us! I expected more out of these and am feeling let down by the whole brand itself. Such a bummer. :/My advice is that if you have ANY issue that cannot be resolved, contact the company through a live chat. They will work with you on what is the problem and will need all of your info on the tablet itself. They then create an RMA for you to fill out and send with the tablet to Texas for servicing. You have to pay the shipping, but they pay for it on the way back to you. Anyway, good luck to those that own this! Another two cents...if you're considering these tablets...don't!Bought two of these for Christmas as a gift to each of my sons, who at the time were 6 and 7. One of them suddenly stopped working recently and we contacted the company directly, in which we live chatted with someone on the issue. After trouble shooting some things, we realized we weren't getting anywhere and the company then sent us a form through an email so we could pack up the tablet and send it to them so it could be checked and fixed if possible. Within two weeks we got the tablet back, just like new. We lost everything as far as what was downloaded game wise (as that's all they play on their tablets) but we expected that and it was not a problem whatsoever as all the games were just free downloads. We had to pay nothing (except shipping TO them, which I was fine with because we just wanted the problem resolved) and had the tablet back so fast that it was just a very simple process overall. With that, I am very satisfied. The company came through on that retrospect fully.The only issue I have is that they never said what the problem was directly, and that is something I would have liked to have known. I don't understand why that is, but I think they could have least told us what was wrong and possibly why. But we got it back fixed and I'm happy with that. So far, so good. We'll see how these hold up in the future. At least I know I can turn to the company for help when needed as they did come through the first time around. I fully back up going through them if you didn't purchase a warranty through Amazon, and especially if you are after the time frame through Amazon as well. Do not go through what's listed in your booklets...I had to google the company and choose United States to get with someone here. They are located in Texas. Any issues, I highly recommend that you try the company first and foremost.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: It replaced my old laptop. It's so lightweight and cute. Plus it's super fast and it's the perfect size for reading, playing games, web surfing, etc.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Pad for basic function
Reviews.Author: Dan J. McClellan
Reviews.Content: Responsive, charge lasts good.  Perfect for multifunction tab - toddler education, social media, news, any other apps.  Very high quality device - especially for low price.

Reviews.Title: Asus 7 HD.
Reviews.Author: Jack Caldicott
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with it. Works great with a lot of useful built in applications. Exceeded my expectations.Really great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: R. Marcela
Reviews.Content: Practical, eficient, great price, great size. It was a gift for the kid and he loves it. Battery life es exceptional and the processor takes all the gaming he does great. Is also great for reading books and watching movies because of the hd screen!

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Mauricio
Reviews.Content: This tablet is perfect for home use, specially for kids. Has good memory so you can install a lot of apps, front and rear camera, although the quality of teh rear camera is really pour, and indoor pictures are pixeled. The screen is very good, multi-touch and very responsive.I recently has a problem with the battery, it said the battery was to warm and had to be removed. I opened the tablet and closed it again to see the battery model, but the battery have not overheated again since then, i guess it had more space to cool of.I  also have a pink one for my dougther, and it has not have any problem.I Recomend it.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Tablet
Reviews.Author: greg carothers
Reviews.Content: I'm satisfied with this tablet however it has limitations but for me this enough, with I recommend to older crowd

Reviews.Title: I didn't buy an iPad mini....I bought a Memo Pad HD!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Arnold
Reviews.Content: Before I bought my Memo Pad, about a month ago, I read all the reviews about it. The reviews that talked about the merits of the tablet itself are the ones I paid attention to. One thing that seemed to fuel my purchase were the constant comparisons to iPad minis and Samsungs. I know in some aspects, comparisons must be made to make a judgement, but the ones that put down the Memo Pad because it wasn't an iPad were ridiculous. This will be a review based on personal experience with the Memo Pad HD.Over the last month I have thoroughly enjoyed myself. I worried about using a 7" tablet because I was used to a 10.1", but it was so heavy! Once it died it was the perfect reason to look into small form factors. Having a smaller budget to work with and knowing what I wanted in a tablet left me with a small group to choose from and this Memo Pad was always at the top.Here's what I like about it:-The 7" size is a perfect fit for me. Fits in my bag nicely and doesn't add much weight. I can hold it in my hands for a long time without my hands, arms or shoulders getting tired. I have wrist and shoulder injuries and can't hold much weight for long. I bought a case for it and I love that too. It fits perfectly with access to the buttons and camera without having to remove it. It's great!-The speed. The quad-core processor was a huge factor in my decision to buy it. I didn't see another tablet in this size with a quad-core processor AND all the other features I was looking for in my price range.-The memory. 16 GB with 32 GB expandable where my 64GB micro sd works and shows up just fine.-The sound is awesome for such a tiny tablet. Louder than my laptop!-The battery life. It's excellent. Heavy usage all day after a full charge and I never need to charge it more than that. I just plug it in before bed.-HD quality. It's high res screen is evident as every color is bright and vibrant and can be even more enhanced with the built in software.-And finally, it's hot pink....HOT PINK!! :)But there's no HDMI output? ... Not once since I've had it have a had the need for one. Not once.Games play great on it, graphics are amazing and sound is outstanding. It's really fast and it hasn't disappointed me yet. There's nothing I don't like about it and that's my honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Device
Reviews.Author: Jairaj
Reviews.Content: This is a high  quality product without the high quality price. It can run any app even including GTA San Andreas one you download it of the internet

Reviews.Title: Good for the price. Not as smooth as iPad.
Reviews.Author: himan
Reviews.Content: This is my first android experience. It is good, but it doesn't work as smooth as iPad.It is hard to touch a small area on the screen. Even when I touch a button carefully, it works unexpectedly.

Reviews.Title: I love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I have used this tablet for a little under a year now. It stayed in my pocket everyday while downrange. Battery lasts for around ten hours and around eight if used extensively.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for school age kids
Reviews.Author: Daniel Thomas Arnold
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my eight year old. It's a great value.  Solid construction and good looks for a reasonable price.  She loves the pink case too.

Reviews.Title: Good choice good price
Reviews.Author: Tracy B. McLendon
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a good pick for my 81 year old mother. (I say "was" because she has lost it already!) � the only draw back from what I experienced was downloading apps. An error message would come up each time an app was added. Which made me hesitant to add more on it.  I had to turn it completely off and begin anew after each app was added. So only two extra apps were added. But the picture was excellent.  Just right for mom.  I wish there was recourse for finding it now.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Patrick G.
Reviews.Content: I've only had this for 5 days. Will update my review in a month.So far I love this tablet. It is not as responsive as the 2013 Nexus 7 but I primarily surf the web, watch movies and TV shows, and play board games like Carcassonne, Elder Sign, & Ticket to Ride. All of Wichita performed flawlessly. I also use it to read PDF's and comics. The screen resolution allows for clear, crisp viewing of both these mediums. There is some hesitation when countering vertical to horizontal viewing and occasional hesitation at launching some apps but nothing to really take a star from the review over.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the money!
Reviews.Author: James H "James H"
Reviews.Content: A very good basic android table for the price! Nice bright screen, good sound, easy to operate. The only drawback is very poor graphics and the fact that is doesn't support any flash player videos (like most tablets).

Reviews.Title: Got It For The Wife, She Likes It
Reviews.Author: N. L.
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife.  I configured it and added some apps for her.  So far she's been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!  But a few issues (see updates)
Reviews.Author: Eduarrdo Nietzsche
Reviews.Content: I have resisted getting a tablet for a long time because I already have an excellent 11.6" Thinkpad mini-laptop for portable use plus a very capable Android smartphone, in addition to a full sized laptop for home/work use, and couldn't imagine any extra functionality that a tablet could possibly provide.Well, until it dawned upon me that rather than waking one of my laptops up from sleep throughout the day to check email, Facebook, news, weather, calendar or to-do lists, I could simply do that on something bigger than my smartphone, which would severely cut down on the battery wear and tear of the smartphone as well as the overall wear and tear of my laptops.At the same time, I was reluctant to plop down $300-500 for one of the premium-level tablets (and definitely not an iPad, since I hate Apple products on principle as well as from experience). That basically left the Google Nexus 7 as the best bang-for-the-buck option, but I was annoyed at its lack of a microSD card slot since I anticipated using the tablet to play music through my car stereo's AUX input during cross country travels.The Asus MemoPad HD 7 pretty much does everything I really need it to do, and at an amazing pricepoint: my local computer geek chain shop had it for a hundred bucks (it's the "Lite" version which has 8GB instead of 16GB of onboard storage, which is irrelevant unless you intend to download tons of games and apps), and I found an open-box one for eighty...truly an offer I couldn't refuse.And am very happy with it so far. It has a relatively limited amount of manufacturer-installed bloatware that cannot be removed or disabled (unlike my girlfriend's Samsung smartphone, which is full of Samsung's proprietary crapware), the 4-core processor (mine has a MediaTek not an "Intel Celeron" as Amazon lists here) and 1GB of RAM that provides a pleasantly snappy user experience, the screen is plenty bright and sharp for my needs (I honestly couldn't see a huge difference with the new Nexus 7's supposedly state-of-the-art display), the battery life is decent...no complaints, really. Caveats: I have a TomTom standalone GPS in my car that I'm very happy with so I can't comment on how GPS navigation works on this thing, and I am not a gamer at all so my graphics/speed requirements are modest at best.One unexpected BIG happy surprise: even though Asus officially says that this tablet only accepts a maximum of 32GB microSD card, it works perfectly fine with my SanDisk 64GB SDXC card! From what I've found via googling, Asus is legally obligated to claim a 32GB max because Microsoft owns the "SDXC" patent/copyright and would demand a heft licensing fee for mentioning its compatibility. Or something to that effect (I'm no lawyer, heh). Anyway, 64GB is ample room for all the music (and video) you could want to take with you.Sure, the back of the casing is a slippery and slightly chintzy plastic that doesn't sit level due to the curious protrusion around the rear camera lens, but hey that's easily taken care of with a seven dollar case that I ordered (you'd be stupid to use a tablet without a case, anyhow).My only niggly complaint is that the capacitative touch screen is not quite as precise and consistent as I would like...about 25% of the time, more than one tap may be needed. This I'm willing to live with, considering the price and overall usefulness of this device!UPDATE 3/26/2014:Have noticed that various malfunctions pop up whenever the tablet is not being held flat on a table, desk, or generally in a stable downward-pressing position. Specifically, using it while supine in bed = a nightmare of missed keystrokes, unresponsive touchscreen presses, random predictive-typing choices automatically chosen for you, the screen auto-rotate going bonkers (I just gave up and turned off the darn feature), the microSD card somehow becoming dislodged such that the tablet thinks you've manually ejected it without electronically unmounting it first---and on and on!  Unless this is a problem universal to all tablets, my guess is that the innards of this device are not securely held together tightly enough, probably part of the cost-cutting measures that resulted in this tablet costing under half that of its higher-end clone, the Nexus 7.  Sigh...it's not a dealbreaker given the price, but it does merit me reducing my rating from 5 to 4 stars.  Just hope that this is not a harbinger of more serious mechanical/hardware breakdowns to come...perhaps I should spring for that Square Trade warranty after all.UDPATE 4/4/2014:The microSDXC card dismounting by itself is becoming a more frequent problem, not limited to only supine use.  This is a HUGE disappointment, since the card slot was the main attraction for buying this darn thing to begin with.  Reduced rating to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: My E-Reader
Reviews.Author: Theresa Chapman
Reviews.Content: I use this as my E-Reader. I play games from time to time or use it to read recipes but mainly as a reader. Love it. Device is easy to load books onto and read in the Kindle App. I love that can wave up or down to change the brightness. The battery saver is awesome and last a long time when WiFi is off.

Reviews.Title: Has Problems
Reviews.Author: JUST-JIM
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem wih this is the inability to play  3rd party apps and games. They will load but when you hit play it dont. This is a big problem as this was to be a gift. Im going to contact Asus ( I hear thats an exercise in futiity) and see what they say. If its a no no, back it goes for a different brand. By the way-Their support site really sucks. They cant find this model. WTF?

Reviews.Title: my son loves it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect tablet for my 7 year old son. Not slow, not too big, he uses it daily.

Reviews.Title: Power
Reviews.Author: Debra L. Stover "debra6502"
Reviews.Content: When I got my Asus, I was like yeah it will be slow like the old tablet I had, but it wowed me right out of the package. This device has more speed and functions than my desktop computer. It glides smoothly, has no problem multi tasking, there is no Wait time. you got it when you want it. I was able to watch movies, play games, get e-mail, and with a few apps place and receive phone calls.Took it to my sons asked him for his wifi password, logged into it and watched a movie while i was there, then when I went back home it had changed wifi accounts seamlessly, wowed me again. I would highly recommend this tablet  to anyone...it is great. The digital cameras are the best that I have had, but I am new to the dig cam world. Would I buy an ASUS again,...yes I would.

Reviews.Title: Great tab but I can't move apps to external SD.
Reviews.Author: Adult Star
Reviews.Content: The best quad core gadget for the price vs specs. Does anyone know how to move apps to micro SD?

Reviews.Title: Great Little Wonder
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something small, light, with basics and a camera and this little fellow has it all plus some great features. It's the perfect little tablet, not too much not to little. This is exactly what I was looking for, it's easy to understand and uncomplicated, but yet sophisticated and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Asus Memopad
Reviews.Author: Marguarita Lopez
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying the Asus pad as I am able to take pictures and use it in my car. I am finding more ways to use it in my every day life.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Cassie Drevniak
Reviews.Content: excellent tablet at a great price. purchased in pink and love the color.  have experienced zero problems with this product. would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Needs Firmware Patch--Can't play popular video apps
Reviews.Author: Thaddius Mumford "Shop Saver"
Reviews.Content: I would have given this tablet at least 4 stars had the firmware been more stable and able to run some of the more popular apps that I enjoy using including Sony Entertainment's Crackle app and Xfinity's TV Go app.  Both of the apps won't work in Asus MeMO Pad HD 7 because of a firmware problem reading the video codecs.  The same apps work perfect in my LG Viper 4G LTE smartphone when connected to data or wifi.  I have asked Asus to fix the problem.  They are workiing on a fix but I am doubful how responsive they will be to actually distribute a firmware patch very soon.  I will add an update to this product review if the come through and provide a fix.  In the meantime, I do not recommend this tablet.  I suggest to anyone who buys a tablet to test it first to make sure it will play popular apps.  I use my tablet for its reading apps and I want to enjoy the video apps, so for me this tablet is practically useless.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Fatima M.
Reviews.Content: I recomended it so much! It is cheap. The battery works great. It isn't slow at all. You can install many applications. Lovely to read it. You can even install FIFA 14. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: This is a great little table for the money.  I got this for my 9 year old son for Christmas and he uses it all the time for internet searches, watching videos, playing games, etc.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet for the Money
Reviews.Author: Science Guy "MP"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fantastic.  Great battery life, clear screen, no lockups.  It is Android based but very well made.  Don't waste your money on a cheap no name tablet.  This will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: It wouldn't turn on!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: ppsker
Reviews.Content: WE have had this little beauty since Christmas past. Not a single problemplaying games, watching Netflix, Amazon prime, Google browsing, and taking pictures! We have loaded it up with every app and social network. We use messaging,e-mail and now video chat! How much fun can two seniors have, until..... it didn't turn on �. Oh my, now what? I'll just plug itinto the back of the computer and kick start it, nope nada, not gonna happen.So went to Asus and sent my repair ticket to them. they are supposed torespond in 24 hrs. I couldn't wait, went on line and read horror stories aboutour beauty. Until a little gal reported," hold down the on button for 60 secondsor more, It'll turn on." By gosh she was right!!!! We are back to it again andhaving fun!  Asus memo pad HD 7 is a Beauty.....�

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Thomas Hottle "Floydian Slip"
Reviews.Content: Just the right form factor. Memory is plentiful, and it works beautifully on most Wi-Fi. Downsides: Sometimes touch screen is not as sensitive as I'd like, and occasionally it needs a restart for some unknown reason. Only happens once every few days. Great device for watching video!

Reviews.Title: Not a bad tablet but not a great one either.
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: SD card in terrible place constantly telling me SD card removed when it's locked in place, hard to type on. Support so so can't download anything to SD card. Camera good battery life good freezes sometimes,picture good, no HDMI slot I've had mine about six months getting a bigger tablet with more features.

Reviews.Title: like it!
Reviews.Author: joey
Reviews.Content: Good android device.  16 gig hard drive is plenty spacious.  Glad 2 c Intel getting more involved in tablet 2.

Reviews.Title: Great product but screen stopped working after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Carlos Garcia
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great I bought as a birthday gift for my daughter and it worked flawlessly for about 2 weeks then the bottom portion of the screen stop working rendering the device pretty much useless which is why I'm giving a 3 star review. I knew that the product was not brand new when I bought it but I have never had any issues with refurbished or used items from Amazon up until now. I'm in the process of return it and getting a refund, I went ahead and bought the same one again only this time new.

Reviews.Title: Not a deal breaker
Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these. The one I gave my wife, I placed a 16 gb micro sd card into and loaded some books to it. As she was using the internet, the sd card would start to say its being mounted and then she would get messages, telling her the card was not properly removed, thinking it was the card I swapped her card for mine. My tablet has been working fine with either card, days on end. So as a word of warning make sure you test that out, Amazon will be replacing the defective one. Otherwise these things are great little things if your not doing too much on them the 1gb ram is a bit limiting.One last thing make sure you get a screen protector right away, I chose the matte finish and it really really makes a difference you can use them outdoors. and fosmon(a bit slow on the shipping) have stiff plastic ones now that are easy to apply. I got a 3 pack and it seems I made the right derision.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews, and was hesitant in purchasing.  After tax time, I went ahead and bought and I've been happy with its performance.  While it may not be as powerful as a Ipad, its cheaper and so far runs smooth, feels well built and has a good battery.

Reviews.Title: more than I dreamed it would be.
Reviews.Author: Glenda L. McMann
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and i love, love it.  My son has helped me set up (since I am a senior citizen) and I don't know why I waited so long to buy one. This one is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Buying books from amazing Amazon
Reviews.Author: rachael
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet.  I use it everyday.  I have not yet had a bad experience with Amazon.com.  I would definitely recommend it to all of my fellow classmates.

Reviews.Title: So happy with this!
Reviews.Author: lovemycats
Reviews.Content: Excellent price - get lots for your money.  This is my first tablet.  I am 60, with poor eyesight, so a smartphone doesn't work for me.  Not that this is a phone - it's not - but I check my email and Facebook frequently during the day.  I'm always looking up something that I can't remember - very helpful!  Kindle App is great.  Have purchased many books.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck in 7" tablets
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet that was under 200, had decent display resolution, allowed SD card slot, and wasn't a piece of crap.This tablet rocks.  I bought 2 others and returned them the first day because they were lame.I would give it 5 stars if it had a physical home button since you lose a bit of screen real estate, and if I could move apps to SD card without rooting.

Reviews.Title: awesome!!!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Martin Monte
Reviews.Content: this is a great tablet, a friend of my bought the nexus for 220$ and i got this one for 120$, its almost the same tablet, and mine has more posibilities than the nexus, great response, the camera works well, fast , sleek ant the batery is amaizing, it last the almost all day with out the need to recharge.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET
Reviews.Author: josh hamman
Reviews.Content: got this tablet for my GF she loves it perfect size great quality. some reviews said its battery life wasnt that great and that screen was dim. i dont see that looks greats is fast and the batterly life is about 7hrs

Reviews.Title: Doing good
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: Well, I've had the tablet for nearly a month now & the only issue I have is the MicroSD card unexpectedly removing itself. It's always done this since day one even before I installed the update. I don't know why it does this but it's really annoying.  I haven't had any other issues that others are having such as charging/powering or dying. But otherwise I think it's a pretty good tablet & I'm really enjoying it so I can only hope & pray that it doesn't burn out on me within the next couple of months as others have complained. Fingers crossed  :-D

Reviews.Title: Was it NEW?
Reviews.Author: Bill Comerford
Reviews.Content: Do not think this item arrived to me as new. There were 2 hard to remove smudges on face of tablet. When wifi connected it showed many strange addresses that my other electronics did not. Same item found at Sams Club online for $128.00 vs $148 at Amazon.  ( NEW) ?

Reviews.Title: Great for kids
Reviews.Author: David R. Russell
Reviews.Content: Very nice & responsive.  Still not an iPad tho.  Great for kids or the elderly with little computer needs or skills.

Reviews.Title: Pleased as punch for the price
Reviews.Author: kfg
Reviews.Content: I bought this after looking for a long time for a tablet that had a powerful processor, a good deal of internal memory, the newest version of Andriod, a long battery life, and an hd screen under $200. The pickin's were slim, and after reading reviews until it seemed like my eyes would explode I bought this one. I liked the ASUS brand in the past and I know several people with the nexus 7 and memo pads - they all loved them, so I felt confident that I would get a good product. So far it has been excellent for what I need. I use my tablet for streaming videos, playing casual games, and social networking. It has worked beautifully, battery life is great, it has a nice speaker in it, all of my games and apps run smoothly. I would recommend for any casual user looking for a quality tablet for under $200.

Reviews.Title: FUN TO USE
Reviews.Author: Nanette
Reviews.Content: I GOT SEVERAL FOR MY GRANDCHILDREN FOR CHRISTMAS IN DIFFERENT COLORS-THEY HAVE HAD ALOT OF FUN WITH THEM. GREAT VALUE FOR THE PRICE AND EASY TO USE!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for my first tablet
Reviews.Author: H.
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late getting into the tablet market, I looked at several different models, and originally was going to go with the Samsung Tab 2 8 until I saw a review mention this one, figured for the price it was worth it.First one I received logged into my wifi no problem, did the system update and it crapped out, not a great way to start off. I tried to reboot it, but it kept going through the install procedure for the update.
