Reviews.Content: Worth the price, good battery , good display, good performance, light weight....everything at a price of less than $150...must to own one .

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: ispeedca
Reviews.Content: Got this on black friday week sale for 119$. For the price its unbelievable, it's fast, bright and comes with sd card reader. What more do you want... mini HDMI outputand a camera flash! But for the price you get more than any other 7in tabs out here. Battery lasts and easy 4-5 hours on heavy gaming or video and around 7-8 hours just doing basic stuff.  I love it and would buy again at this price anytime.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pad
Reviews.Author: Jess Portwood
Reviews.Content: Have only had a couple of months and have not used it a lot.  So far, I like it pretty good. It is easy to use and has good speed. Have only used for email & surfing the net.Con:  No manual came with it & am having problems trying to download one. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: top product for 1st timers
Reviews.Author: Pete In Illinois
Reviews.Content: fast and quick. bought two of these for my sisters as Christmas gifts. one sister can't (or won't) work a computer. I have her gift set up so now i can call her ans all she has to do is answer it. if she wants to read her email, no problem, i have one button st up for her to do that. She has no more excuses for NOT using a computer to communicate with me. and her husband will love it cause i have it set up with free google voice, Merry Christmas?Happy birthday Jane.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MEMO pad HD 7 16 gb
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cornelius "depdan001"
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet a few weeks now. The tablet has met all my expectations. Screen is clear and bright, excellent sound volume and quality. Camera takes nice pictures. Android apps have run without any issues. Battery runtimes have been close to 9 to 10 hours under normal use and holds a charge several days under light use.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Plus fastest delivery in history
Reviews.Author: E. FORTIER "E4TA"
Reviews.Content: Arrived the day after ordering. I've been playing with this tablet for a week and I love it. Planning to buy another one for my husband

Reviews.Title: A very good buy
Reviews.Author: book reader "book reader"
Reviews.Content: Just about has everything i want to do. I want to be able to record in text while writing like Samsung Galaxy tablet. But i cannot do it with this tablet. It is also a little bit slow in response with my input, especially when changing application. Sometimes it just stopped. Overall, it is still a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Great for the price.  Could not pass up the opportunity to purchase a good quality device at this price.  Came quickly.

Reviews.Title: Pretty snappy even under the heavy game content.
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: Picked this up for my son and we are both very pleased.  Pretty snappy even under the heavy game content.

Reviews.Title: Screen isn't good in sunlight.  Can't read if there is any glare.
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Antolik
Reviews.Content: I have never used a tablet before..this came without any instructions!  It has definetly been learning by trial and lots of errors.  i'm sure there is a ton of stuff I should be able to do with it but don't know how to access.  Screen isn't good in sunlight, very dim.

Reviews.Title: asus tablet rock!
Reviews.Author: michael a mcdowell
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing! Id say a must buy ! I got it on sale for 130 so i couldnt psss it up! Evenat full price its worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Terrific!
Reviews.Author: BigJ
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific tablet with lot's of computing power at a very reasonable price.  Glad I got one and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: memo 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: For a tablet this one is more than amazing.The price was very reasonable and the tablet was very comparable to the high priced ones. You can't go wrong with this product.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: Amazing product, got it when it was on sale for 120 dollars, couldn't be happier. Very fast, very clear screen. Buy the Transcover case for it right away, you will not be displeased. As well as an Anti Fingerprint screen protector. Helps a TON with the fingerprints.Best bang for the buck you can have right now. Don't waste your money on a 400 ipad, or whatnot. This is a beast for the money. Good updates from Asus as well, firmware updates are fast and reliable.You may see some reviews talking about how "weird" it is that the bottom is a bit wider than the top and causes an "uncomfortable" edge around the unit. First of all, its barely noticeable. Second of all, its so the Transcover will snap onto the device and you don't have to worry about things coming up around the edges of your screen.

Reviews.Title: MeMO
Reviews.Author: Mitch
Reviews.Content: My kids were given the MeMo after my wife and I did a lot of research.  The best thing about the kids using the MeMo for school and fun was the low cost and timely delivery.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the tablet, especially after the latest update 4.2.2.
Reviews.Author: Andrey
Reviews.Content: Pros: good battery life, design and durability, softwareCons: the screen is not too good on the sunlight, but that's the issue with the most of tablets

Reviews.Title: Great tablet by Asus.
Reviews.Author: WandsMagic
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 7 inch tablet to replace a Z-Pad that I had purchased earlier this year. This tablet is extremely fast. The battery seems to last forever. The screen is sharp and bright. The WiFi is very reliable and fast. Asus seems to really standby their products.  I had a problem viewing Netflix and after loading a couple of system updates, it works perfectly. I really love this tablet. The sale price has increased on Amazon, probably because it was such a bargain at $129 when I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: Why pay more money for the Apple name, this tablet does the same , maybe more for 1/4 the price.Very fast processor, great display color, sound and text.also much  ram of memory.Feels rugged in my hands, must have been made to last.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Chris Bond
Reviews.Content: Had a few problems at first with the unit. It kept saying SD card removed every 10 mins. or so. The card is a brand new Samsung 8 GB so I don't think it is a faulty card. The tablet works great and does everything I need. Hopefully I don't have a bad SD card slot.

Reviews.Title: Nice and mostly responsive.  Good screen resolution.
Reviews.Author: Ferdimark Mariano
Reviews.Content: A pre-installed widget keeps on crashing the system.  It had to do trial and error to find cause of the problem.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Cristina Carrasco
Reviews.Content: Years ago I bought an ASUS laptop and it was good, that was the reason why I choose this tablet.I've had it only for two days, so I still discovering all of its features. So far I love it and I haven't had any problem.

Reviews.Title: Really great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Dr. Chris Barras
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with the overall speed and great screen resolution.  So far the battery life is great also.  Love that it has expandable memory

Reviews.Title: First tablet
Reviews.Author: Reader
Reviews.Content: My first tablet! I do wish I had bought a windows tablet now. I've been using Android phones for so long that I didn't think about compatibility. I am enjoying the use of the tablet, and it's easy to use since I'm familiar with android.

Reviews.Title: love this device
Reviews.Author: Joan Silva "joansilva52"
Reviews.Content: love this device. It's excellent, easy to set up and nicely sync's with my Google stuff. Android friendly. Does just what I need. Only one thing, wish it was 4G

Reviews.Title: Great value tablet
Reviews.Author: Rogerp
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, this tablet does everything asked of it - it's quick, very nice graphics, strongly built. Essentially a budget version of the Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Fine Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice and clear screen, good camera. Would have been nice to have some instructions with how to handle it though.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Last
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Scudder "RSA"
Reviews.Content: Seemed to be fairly clear and responsive.  Died within 4 days.  I have requested another and we will see how it does.

Reviews.Title: Good all the way
Reviews.Author: Chan
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative, delivery and product definitely exceeds expectation!! Thumbs Up!! Will definitely try to make more orders but some cannot be deliver to Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: one of the best tablets in the market
Reviews.Author: jonathan ardila
Reviews.Content: bought it for my Girlfriend, she loves it and its very handy , great product for the price. one of the best tablets in the market

Reviews.Title: You are poor this is the perfect tablet for you
Reviews.Author: BOYAFG "AFG2012"
Reviews.Content: Very good table for the price. If you are poor or don't want to spen a lot of money on a table buy this one it a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Ordered this for my daughter for her birthday!
Reviews.Author: Gena Proctor
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for my daughters birthday and she absolutely loves it!!  I think it is a part of her wardrobe!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet with 1.2 Ghz with Quad-Core and Bluetooth !
Reviews.Author: LINDY "Lindy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 7"Asus tablet for Christmas for my 12 year old daughter.  This is a perfect size for her to take along with her to Grand-ma's house.  The price is unbeatable for the quality your are getting, 1.2 Ghz with a Qud-core processor and it has blue tooth.  The customer review by M. Erb was very informative.  Watch his video, he states that Asus makes the Nexus tablet for Google.  Great info.  The seller delivered the tablet quickly and well packaged.  Thank You !

Reviews.Title: Cool.
Reviews.Author: PK
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our 1 year old daughter. She gets fussy when we travel and this is perfect for her. She watches all her favorite cartoons while we're in the car and she won't fuss at all. She'll also be able to play learning games when she gets a little older. It's not at pricey as the IPAD but it gets things done.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet, Blue (ME173X-A1-BL)
Reviews.Author: Francis R. Losche "Poobah"
Reviews.Content: the ease of getting through pages it's a lot faster than what I had before, would recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: toby scott
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what I wanted -- an inexpensive tablet I can take with me and not worry about losing/breaking it.  For more money there are better tablets, but this did not disappoint at the price.  Nice job.

Reviews.Title: complete, compact, cool
Reviews.Author: Minneapplemuffin "Deals, Deals, Deals"
Reviews.Content: Very nice little tablet for the price!  I love the pink and how intuitive this product is.  The exterior is a bit slippery and did not come with a screen protector.  A must have for this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great price and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Chris Thornton
Reviews.Content: Great price and easy to use.  I bought for my wife to use on an upcoming trip and she is already an expert with the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: David Seo
Reviews.Content: This is working out well for me.  $20 price drop within a month of purchase not good.  I am in the process of getting an OTG cable to attach a keyboard.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MemoPad-Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Thuy
Reviews.Content: stellar tablet for an awesome price.  works very well, response time is great.  pretty good operating system.  overall, its a quality product.

Reviews.Title: perfect buying choice.....
Reviews.Author: drocaberte
Reviews.Content: perfect choice....i really highly recommend this item to all users. it's all in one memo pad. perfect for my needs...

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: John Rivera
Reviews.Content: Excelente máquina, Super recomendada. It's fast, I can install almost everything, Good price for good machine. I recommend it to you

Reviews.Title: Awwesome
Reviews.Author: Fouad Ahmed
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my daughters and they love it. I am not a big fan of android. However, my daughters love them.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far I love this tablet! It's fully capable of handling what I need, netflix, facebook, kindle, etc. I don't game so for my purposes its great.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MemoPad HD 7
Reviews.Author: M. Morine "Kukaepe"
Reviews.Content: I really like my Memo Pad.  I wanted a small tablet to access the internet and my e-mail while traveling without packing my laptop.  This wi-fi enabled tablet is perfect to accomplish these tasks well at a very attractive price.  The larger and more "designer" tablets are very nice but at 3X the price I don't see the point.  Excellent screen and many free apps available.  Great deal, thanks Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: harry Smith
Reviews.Content: Love this tab. It does everything I could ask of it at a great price. My kids are jealous and want one too!

Reviews.Title: The power button is a little hard to get to in the case but overall a very good tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: devildog
Reviews.Content: Bought this for granddaughter basically because of the proven ASUS tables and a normal mini USB for charging allowing us to us any of our tablet chargers.  She loves it!

Reviews.Title: very happy!!!
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: Love it. Works great! Not to big, not to small. Just the right size. Can fit in coat pocket to take to work. No problems at all so far. Very happy with it. Thank you

Reviews.Title: fast - brilliant color
Reviews.Author: J. Brumme
Reviews.Content: I really like this pad. It's hard to beat for the price.. very fast at loading. the battery does last a long time. I keep it in sleep mode most of the time when not using it..and still goes for days

Reviews.Title: NICE! i loved it when I saw it, and I still do! :)
Reviews.Author: Davidikons
Reviews.Content: Surprised by the excellent performance of this tablet. This is my first tablet so I have nothing to compare to but certainly fulfills everything a standard user needs. I use it to read news, books, music, videos, and responds perfectly. The battery lasts long and recharges very quickly, also uses the wifi signal to the fullest.I have not tried games, but all applications perform with great efficiency and speed. The screen is sensitive and the back of the tablet so is, so I recommend you buy it together with a protective coverAs we say in my country: "Good, Pretty, Cheap" - "Bueno, bonito, y barato"

Reviews.Title: good product at nice price!
Reviews.Author: damon
Reviews.Content: it is a portable, sharpe color, fast app funtion, working smoothly 7inch pad. I like ASUS, planning to buy second one.

Reviews.Title: Kids Love Them
Reviews.Author: MT-Techman
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these for the kids in pink, green and blue.  They use them a ton and they work great.  One of them stopped booting after about 1 week for some reason (remember, these are 10-14 year old kids) but we were able to exchange it through Amazon :)Skype works, camera takes decent pictures.  It seems fast and smooth.  Battery is OK.  Build quality isn't super, but for the price, we're happy.  Screen is nice and has a great picture.  Purchased a nice leather case for them, and all is well!

Reviews.Title: amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Joselin Cols
Reviews.Content: I love it, amazing tablet for the price. It's a beautiful tablet with a very good screen resolution and durable battery. The rear camera 5MP is good, I would recomend it, it is a good investment. :-)

Reviews.Title: Delivery and performance good
Reviews.Author: ROCCO GAGLIO
Reviews.Content: The delivered time and the ASUS HD was very good (specially HD performance). I recomended, I plan to give as christmast gift to my 7 year old child!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Walid Hamdan
Reviews.Content: Excellent little tablet, my son is very happy with it, does everything he want it to do. Works great the screen resolution is decent processor is very good the rear 5 MP camera is good for what he need it for. So for the $150.00 Tablet I would recomend it and I think it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: 6 year old loves it
Reviews.Author: waldemar Jackson
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 6 year old it works really well and sometimes freezes up but for the most part it is a solid piece of tech, like any tech if it overheats it will slow down and freeze. my suggestion is don't play with it while having it plugged into the charger; all programs run smoothly when the device is not hot (rarely over heats) my 6 year old plays for hours without issues. I'm very impressed, screen is very bright works very well for what it does and works for most of people to play with it ; those with  high level tech experience would be still impressed with its hardware. What I found is that certain programs are good , some are bad on the play store, so therefore they will freeze on any tablet or smartphone (fruit ninja) so could it be hardware yes,? software yes? we will never know why things hang up if the device isn't hot, but if you're looking for cheap tablet to give as a gift, or order for yourself and don't want to spend a ton of money this is your tablet.

Reviews.Title: screen resolution good, response fast, price cheap
Reviews.Author: Dino
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this item on October and try it, I found the screen resolution good (1280*800),  good internal memory 16G, touch screen response fast and nice price ( compare with Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (7-Inch screen 1024*600 8G memory internal) or Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7-Inch screen 10240*600 8G memory internal)). over all, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade issue
Reviews.Author: Huy T.
Reviews.Content: My Asus memo pad hd 7 has problem with upgranding firmware 4.2.2.It always says "asssert failed: apply patch check system/app/applicationsprovider.apkUpdate.zip is incorrectInstallstion aborted."it is reason i give 4 stars for iti will exchange a new one. Someone tell me how

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Maor
Reviews.Content: It's a great Tablet compare to its price, working pretty fast when surfing the internet or watching live streaming.Really recommended

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Larry waldrip
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these tablets one for me and one for my wife and we both love them and could not live with out our little tablets. We travel allot with my job and take our tablets everywhere.

Reviews.Title: easy to use and many great features.
Reviews.Author: ken stiner
Reviews.Content: I reviewed several tablets and the Asus Memopad HD 7 inch ME173X had the most options that I was looking for.It had an SD slot to add an additional 32K memory, front and rear cameras, long life battery, plus a GPS app.I would recommend this tablet to everyone. Also I can send an email to my web enabled printer, it prints properly.And many more apps and features I have yet to explore.  No problems yet and really don't expect any.  I'm looking forward to experimenting and learning more about my tablet.

Reviews.Title: ASUS tablet
Reviews.Author: jb
Reviews.Content: Ok husband loves it............wish I had one. I already have a kindle fire Hd and nook HD+ but I may end up buying this as well since he won't let me use it. :)

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: clm
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for me.  It's the first I've ever had but it's great and does what I need.  Very impressive for the money.

Reviews.Title: lovely budget tablet
Reviews.Author: Varune
Reviews.Content: well i absolutely love this tablet. i bought this and a nexus 7 and it runs on par with the nexus for 50$ less..i would recommend this tablet for anyone who is on a budget. it has everything you need. you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: Asus delivers quality products on consistent basis
Reviews.Author: clocker08
Reviews.Content: Great product exceptional pix quality highly recommended for this price range great value. This is mainly used to watch movies & stream music

Reviews.Title: High quality for a good price
Reviews.Author: D.S
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am very satisfied with my buy. The speed of processing is very good and the graphics too. Very recommended. I work on IT

Reviews.Title: A definite good buy!
Reviews.Author: johanna
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great! Fast, capable, easy to use and compact. You won't find a better tablet for a price like this.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Carlos André de Paula Mendes
Reviews.Content: great tablet, easy to navigate, well finished, great display, well-defined colors, fast. Only the sound I found a little low, but nothing detrimental games / movies / etc. The battery life is very good.

Reviews.Title: wonderful tablet
Reviews.Author: tony
Reviews.Content: good item and better then other tablet.very easy access.also,very handy for take anywhere you like.also, pretty light for carry any place I want

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Rick Maes
Reviews.Content: Great price for well performing tablet.  Also have a nexus 7 and this tablet is better on price and camera capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet !
Reviews.Author: Roger E. Mundinger "rem."
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet for traveling and is just the right size for what I do with it. It is fast and I have had lots of fun with it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Douglas Borrero Villamizar
Reviews.Content: I'm gratefully pleased with this purchase. This tablet is powerful, ligthweigth, and performs smoothly. The screen resolution is perfect, and the sound is very good. Updates to Android 4.2.2 as soon as you connect it to wi-fi. Really recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good alternative to the new Nexus HD 7
Reviews.Author: shopper
Reviews.Content: Satisfied after a month of use. $120 less than the nexus I was considering. Will consider more upscale tablet once the operating systems debate is settled.

Reviews.Title: Asus as done it again excellent tablet.
Reviews.Author: The Shadow
Reviews.Content: My initial impressions are overwhelmingly positive. The more I use the tablet the more amazed I am that something at this price point can be so capable. One nice surprise: when I close my tablet cover, the screen automatically sleeps and it automatically awakens when I open the cover. This is by far the best performing low cost tablet on the market today. I may get the 10" version of it.

Reviews.Title: Very usable, cost effective tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Everything my phone will do except the telephone. Only downside is accessibility of on/off and volume switches. Case turns it on when opened which minimizes the problem.

Reviews.Title: Great for the kids
Reviews.Author: Bagehi
Reviews.Content: Bought these for the kids.  They love them.  Easy to use, sturdy, and the charger is standard so can easily be replaced when they lose theirs.  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: It's ASUS, you know it's good
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: While I don't have a lot of experience with different tablets I know I like this one. At first I wondered if something was wrong when it would not work with Netflix. Then ASUS updated the OS (automatically) and Netflix worked without a hitch. In my mind, for the money, you will not find a better deal right now.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet for the price!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "theskeemer"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my kid and it is great. Very easily rooted with the Framaroot one-click apk rooting tool. The stock rom is very nice and if you delete it you can easily remove the bloatware with titanium backup.

Reviews.Title: Total Tablet newbie
Reviews.Author: Becky in NOLA "Becky"
Reviews.Content: No one in my immediate family has had a tablet or a smart phone. My phone is an IQ-challenged flip phone. So I am not going to be addressing the ois (operating system?) or comparing this to my other tablets. Nope, this is just a story of an older tablet-deprived woman, looking high and low for a tablet to suit her needs, not wanting to spend a lot, and finding the tablet of her dreams.My needs were fairly simple, below 200 dollars, decent ratings, able to handle netflix, skype- very important, at least 1/2 the reason I was getting a tablet was the ability to Skype home when we are traveling, something to look up stuff when we're traveling, download a few apps for fun, play spotify, and take a picture or two.The ASUS MeMo was rated fairly highly both on amazon and through other websites, the price was right, the size was right, so we took the plunge and found the tablet that does everything I need and want.Netflix plays wonderfully, the screen is really crisp. The ASUS is friendly, I tap away and it responds and we are happily learning about each other. I do sometimes have to tap twice with my stylus, it's not something that bothers me.The battery lasts a long time. I played with it and my sons played with it and my husband played with it and I have had to charge it once in 5 days, so not bad.The pictures I take with it are fine. If I was shooting a wedding or something then no, but for a quickie shot or a fun selfie - because it has a camera in front and back- it works just fine.I like the sound quality. Spotify sounds good and the movie sounded good.The fact that it easily orientates from up and down to landscape is a bonus. It responds fast, too.I don't find the tablet either heavy or light, it doesn't feel flimsy to me, although I do have it in a rooCase. I find it easy to hold and operate if I'm sitting up or laying back on the couch.I'm sure that a 600 dollar tablet might have more gizmos or something, but for the price point I was looking at, and the functions I wanted this is the perfect affordable tablet.*Update 12/1/2013We love this tablet so much we bought one for the family to share (this one is mine!) and will probably buy another one for each to have later one. The guys love watching netflix while riding the treadmill. We haven't had any issues and really are enjoying the tablet a lot.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: Pros: I use it for surfing the web, email, Facebook, Fantasy Football and it works great. Also able to view Excel and Word docs  from email. Battery lasts long and the screen has great resolution. Can't beat it for the price.Cons: I wish the camera had a flash, pictures seem a bit grainy in low light. I haven't used the camera in daylight outside yet.

Reviews.Title: Just keeps getting better and better
Reviews.Author: J. Foley
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Android tablet.  Prior to this was the Archos and then the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (7").  I used the Samsung for 18 months and was very content.  Figured it was time to upgrade to a quad-core.  The ASUS outperforms the Samsung by a landslide.  The touch screen is better too, as the Samsung was a bit unresponsive near the perimeter.  Battery life seems good with the Asus thus far.  I watched a full length movie on Netflix and didn't put much of a dent into the battery meter.Overall, I'm amazed at what $149 buys in computing capability today.  This is a fraction of the price of an iPad and works fantastic.

Reviews.Title: kudos to asus for an affordable tablet that works great
Reviews.Author: Brian D Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: asus hit the nail on the head with this tablet in providing a tablet for folks who don't have a ton of money and desire all the great features it comes with like the front and back camera, the external microSD card (32GB max) slot, the fast quad-core processor, and the HD display. i haven't tested the bluetooth, yet, but everything else works great. the touch screen is not unresponsive as some reviewers suggest, but usually is an indication of the tablet busy finishing the bootup or doing an update. i have used it daily for a about 30 days. people who have issues with it not powering on are letting their battery get too low. just don't let the battery fall much below 40% before charging and you likely will not have the issue some others have had with the tablet not powering on. if it does happen to you anyway, and you find that charging it overnight with the supplied usb charger doesn't help, just plug it into to your pc with the same supplied usb cable (without the ac plug adapter) for at least a few minutes and you should be able to power the tablet back on. Next power it down completely and then let it charge to 100% with either your pc's usb port or plug it into your ac power.

Reviews.Title: Great...
Reviews.Author: iamaranoverkat
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband so I don't use it...I am hooked on my Kindle. He loves this device and uses it all the time. The battery life is excellent. He has not mentioned any problems with this device. If you are looking for a simple device that won't break the bank this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Best 7" tablet band for you buck
Reviews.Author: Snapperheadjoe
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews already that go into great deal about this tablet so I won't waste your time covering what I'm sure many other people have expounded on already.  What I will do is a very short comparison to the two other 7" tablets I own with this one.Here it goes: compared to the Samsung Tab 2 7" $170 and the Acer Iconia A100 7" $300 the Asus MeMOPad HD 7 $150 is AMAZING!  You won't find another tablet that performs this well at this price point on the planet.  Don't get me wrong the Samsung Tab 2 is a very nice tablet  but it weighs more, doesn't have an HD screen, dual-core vs. quad-core and costs more.  The Acer (is dead by the way) is an all around failure.  It was their first generation tablet and the general slowness, heaviness and suckiness shows, however it did have an LED flash... Hurray for Acer!  Oh I almost forgot it costs twice as much as the HD 7.I also own the Asus Transformer $350 and Asus Tab TF300t $400, both 10" tablets. The HD 7 is just as responsive as the newer TF300t and outperforms the older Transformer.I was blown away by the build quality of this $150 tablet.  Yes its plastic just like almost every other tablet out there.  It has a solid build with a very good quality HD screen and the full compliment of hardware Quad-core Processor, GPS, Bluetooth, micro SD Slot, stereo speakers, dual cameras, 16GB storage, Android 4.2.1 etc.I can't emphasize this enough, you won't find a better tablet by a major manufacturer at this price point.  Great Job Asus!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and first experience with Android.Set up was quick and easy.  I bought a cheap Roo case which I love; you open cover and the tablet wakes up automatically.  And I wanted protection for when I drop the tablet.Pros:1. Battery life is GREAT.  You can leave it hooked up to wifi, with tablet in sleep mode, and battery lasts days.2. Response is plenty good for me; I don't play games on it though.3. Screen is beautiful and responsive to touch.4. Keyboard is very positive and the only errors are caused by me.5. Music sounds good.Cons:  None yetI am new to Android and had trouble downloading my Windows 7 music files (.wma) to the tablet.  I learned while chatting with ASUS tech that Android does not accept microsoft ".wma" files.  I had to get converter software to convert .wma to .mp3.  I blame Microsoft for this inconvenience, not Android or ASUS.I found that it was not easy to get information off of the ASUS customer service site.  I don't think they have yet entered this product into the support data base because it does not recognize model number,model name, or automatic recognition.  So I could not enter support FAQ, etc for this device.But it is fairly easy to find out how to chat with an ASUS tech and they set me straight on .wma and .mp3 music files and the need to convert .wma.So far I think this tablet has very good value.

Reviews.Title: nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my tablet.  It meets my requirements.  I haven't had any problems with it so far since I got it a few weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant device at competitive price
Reviews.Author: Matthias Engelen
Reviews.Content: Great for watching my videos and playing the occasional game.Same quality as an iPad or a Galaxy device.Small, light and long battery life.Touch screen is very responsive.Comes with loads of tools, Google play (market) works like a charm.And it has an SD card slot, something I wanted and neither Nexus nor Kindle Fire offer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect internet tablet.
Reviews.Author: Shea Evans
Reviews.Content: It's fast.  The screen is very nice, and very responsive.  Pretty much zero lag.  The camera is pretty good, (no flash, so what).  The speaker is loud and clear.  I literally have nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Aaron Kukla
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  I have been waiting for a mini tablet that has both a decent camera and removable storage.  I can take this into the woods to view pictures on my game camera.  Then I stop in town at a WiFi hotspot and text the pictures to my buddies.  I did have an issue with netflix not playing properly, but it was easily fixed by updating the android software in the settings tab.

Reviews.Title: Show me the money
Reviews.Author: LucyBT "One Task"
Reviews.Content: Buy yourself the Google Nexus Android 4.3 Jelly Bean for $229 plus $50 Accidental protection or $279.00. Or buy this Memo tablet made by the same manufacturer for $150 plus $30 Accidental protection or $180.With the $100 you save, you can buy an SD card for extra storage of music, pictures and docs on the Memo.  Don't bother buying one for the Nexus though because it doesn't take one.

Reviews.Title: Really cool toy
Reviews.Author: RAB
Reviews.Content: I bought one of those Google TV sticks a while back just to have a look at Android. That was impressive enough to inspire me to shell out a bit more on a tablet. I tossed and turned between A Kindle Fire HD , A Google Nexus 7/10 and then I found this. Not as impressive a machine but still very good reviews. The real clincher to the deal was the SD slot, nothing better than expansibility. I don't really have a use for it, but it is surprisingly useful. Great to have weather, tides news and the internet on a device that is truly portable and fast. The Google stuff is awesome and easy to find and use. Amazon is available through an app. and it behaves just as I imagine a Kindle would. I love reading on it. Battery life is impressive provided you turn the GPS off. It doesn't work indoors which means it chews up battery looking for a lock.

Reviews.Title: Asus ME173X Tablet
Reviews.Author: B. G. Smith
Reviews.Content: My grandson saved his money for this tablet and he got a good value for the cost.  It is newer and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: MeMo Pad HD
Reviews.Author: Mysels
Reviews.Content: Love it. Very responsive. Great screen. Did update and now plays my Netflix flawlessly. For the money, I think it is a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Feras Elfadel
Reviews.Content: includes compass and gps 5 mp camera, long life battery good touch screen, this more than i need, i like it

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: FLgirl
Reviews.Content: I've been researching tablets a lot and finally decided on this one.  It has everything I want, a front and rear camera, a slot for a micro-SD card, etc.  I'm not a big gamer, so the price to me was the main draw.  The only thing it doesn't have that I wish it did is a flash for the rear camera, but I'm perfectly happy without it.

Reviews.Title: Great device. Great value.
Reviews.Author: Doug Lee Drysdale
Reviews.Content: Beyond expectations. Fast, beautiful, user friendly, seamless integration with PC and phone via Google Play and Chrome. Goodbye Apple :)

Reviews.Title: Great unit and great price
Reviews.Author: Vincent Petrazzuoli
Reviews.Content: I waited for this new model to come out because of the extra feature's like the rear camera and the microSD expansion slot.  This is my first tablet of any kind so I have nothing else to compare it with.  That being said, it's a great unit that is fast and responsive and you cannot beat the price to the features.  I would recomment this.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight and easy to carry in my purse
Reviews.Author: Mysterious Reviewer
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMOPad is lightweight and small enough to easily carry inside your purse which I love. I do own a generation 1 iPad and I love my iPad but it can be a bit heavy and too large for carrying around inside my purse. The ASUS tablet is not and has become my favorite tablet to take to the grocery store as I have used a well-known grocery app to make my grocery store list. I could also use a note pad app to make up my grocery list, if I desired.Other pluses concerning this tablet include:Ease of selecting apps. I found and downloaded several apps for free from Amazon and there are other websites you could do the same. With the iPad it's Apple only as best as I can tell.Reading my Kindle books are easy too as I do believe this was already included with the ASUS tablet.The tablet itself provides clear images and crisp colors when it comes to reading or viewing websites.The one drawback is the ASUS tablet is not as intuitive as the Apple iPad. This could be caused by my familiarity with using the iPad versus an android tablet.Another drawback is the non-removable battery used to power the ASUS tablet.Recommend.Penmouse

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet and was immediately impressed by the screen, it was gorgeous!  The only other small tablet I have used is the Kindle Fire HD, and I much preferred the Asus because of the screen and the very nice OS (I hate the Kindle carousel).  This tablet seemed faster, and was very easy to setup.  I installed a few apps from the Google Play store and it was all flawless.So why 1 star?The battery came partially charged, and that's all the use I've gotten out of it, about 3 hours.  Now it is completely dead.  It will not charge, connecting it to a PC does not help.  I've tried different outlets, different chargers, all to no avail.I probably received a lemon, and will revise my review based on the service I get.Update: I sent the first unit in for repair.  It took a 20 minute phone call or so.  I received the unit back in a bit over a week.  The second unit lasted a month or so.  It was just sent in for repair, for exactly the same problem, it just dies.  My wife really likes the tablet when it works, so we're a bit bummed that it keeps dieing.  Hopefully it will last a bit longer when we receive it back.

Reviews.Title: Not the best experience
Reviews.Author: Emil Jorge Manzur
Reviews.Content: First off let me say I've had many tablets and also ASUS products, but this one is close to the worst i have ever had, right after i received i started experiencing some funny BATTERY OVERHEATING ISSUE, it happened seldomly and the tablet would turn off, over the last couple of months, the issue has developed and now the tablet is useless, it so bad that drains the battery in a matter of minutes, so honestly i wouldn't recommend it to anyone, stick to the M172 its way better and these issues don't happen, extremely disappointed, will think twice before buying this tablet

Reviews.Title: Garbage Asus Tablet
Reviews.Author: Devinder Singh
Reviews.Content: Garbage Tablet. After 4 Month not turning on. Cheap in quality. I saw lots of review not turning on. They should call it back.Not recommended at all. Just Garbage and wastage of money.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Jerry Vanalstyne "radio lover"
Reviews.Content: It never worked from the first time I tried it. I took it from the box plugged it in to charge it. After about 5 hours I unplugged it and tried to use it. It froze up  and would never work.Amazon was great about the problem and I returned for refund.I also returned a cover I bought for it which was fine but since I don't have the asus I won't need the cover.I'm hopeing amazon doesn't charge me the shipping for returning it.True there's nothing wrong  with it but I can't use it because of no fault of mine. i giving 2 stars for easy returns to amazon

Reviews.Title: waste of money ( updated review)
Reviews.Author: shawn911 "shawn911"
Reviews.Content: This device has been shutting down over and over i purchased it for the black Friday sale 2013. It would normally shut down 50 - 40 % of the battery.When it normally shuts down it would come on the following day. This would only happen when plugged to the charger and in doing so there is a always flashing of the battery symbol in red. Yesterday 24th march 2014 it recently shut down at 100% of the battery  and won't come on.!!! I also know another asus user who purchased their device same time around like i did and is encountering the same issue. the funny thing is I made another purshace of this item not to long ago  i await to see if it is going to do the same thing.DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!MY SECOND PURCHASE OF THIS DEVICE STILL HAS ISSUES. THE SECOND ONE HAS DIFFICULTY POWERING IT UP.HOLDING THE POWER BUTTON FOR THE REQUIRED TIME WONT HELP. PLEASE GET ANOTHER PRODUCT DONT PURCHASE THIS ITEM!!!

Reviews.Title: Five Stars For Amazon's Return Policy
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet when the battery does not give you problems. Really great. I got two returned both because of battery problems. Amazon was good enough to give me my money back on both occasions.But, I missed the tablet. It's that good. So, I bought another and, so far, the battery has not given any problems. Hence, the 4 star rating.I think the trick is to never turn the thing off. Just keep on charging as recommended on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Battery stopped charging
Reviews.Author: Donna Wynn "Retired RN on a spiritual journey."
Reviews.Content: The tablet won't charge, I did everything because I like the tablet, changed plugs tried different sockets, nothing.  Saw this review from a customer today...............UPDATE: 1/2/2014 - Some bad news. My MemoPad refuses to charge now. Suddenly, I plugged the MicroUSB cable to the MemoPad for charging yesterday and nothing happened. I checked the plug and it was fine but I tried two other cables just to ensure it wasn't a flaky cable. It wasn't. Also checked it with several different AC chargers and on my laptop. NO dice. It won't charge. I then tried a hard reset by holding the power button for 1 minute, connecting USB to power and repeating the procedure. Nothing. My MemoPad is on it's way back to ASUS for warranty repair. I'll leave my rating intact for the time being. I may have to lower it depending on the outcome. I realize that some defects occur so I will give the benefit of the doubt for now.

Reviews.Title: Lemon
Reviews.Author: Jeff Warner
Reviews.Content: We bought this tablet in late November for Christmas. We really enjoyed it for the first two months. We took very good care of it and followed all the instructions and rules. The tablet will not turn on and will not charge. I have heard that they're a few lemons out there and it just so happens we bought one of them. I am very disappointed in this purchase. We are not able to return this lemon because it's been over two months. I'm also disappointed in Amazon for not giving us a replacement after only two months. What a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: surprisingly great tablet
Reviews.Author: Kenneth
Reviews.Content: Got this with birthday money when it came out and pleasantly surprised by the quality. I new I wanted a smaller tablet just wasn't sure which one. Usually in electronics if the price is cheap then the product is. I knew wanted android os for some apps like snes emulator and torrent ones, but there weren't many good choices at the time. Then Asus released the memo and the updated version of the nexus. I picked this over the nexus because the ability to use memory cards. The screen is really nice, but shows fingerprints and is rubbish in direct sunlight. The plastic back doesn't feel cheap and the speaker is nice. I have been using it constantly watching videos, playing games, and browsing the internet. Even with the very heavy use the battery still lasts all day on one charge.

Reviews.Title: High perfomance
Reviews.Author: jmachado
Reviews.Content: This table asus memopad is gift for my wife. Is fast. The screen is hd. Fast acces at internet. I recomended.

Reviews.Title: Great idea but terrible quality--I had to return it
Reviews.Author: D. Bradford
Reviews.Content: I really liked the price of this tablet and the features.  I thought the camera was great and the screen resolution was satisfactory.  It was responsive enough when opening apps etc but almost immediately out of the box, I noticed that the screen would flicker, or sometimes break up into static.  The screen would also periodically return to primary colors, flashing blue, red, and green, and wouldn't stop until I rebooted the tablet.It was a very frustrating experience using a tablet I really wanted to like.  This is my first Asus MemoPad so maybe I just got a bad one, but if the quality control is this poor, I didn't want to risk getting a replacement that might fail 2 weeks or 2 months from now--so I returned for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Should of Listen to the other bad reviews....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Graphic Artist/Photographer"
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas for my 11yr old daughter & it lasted for only 2 weeks.  The tablet couldn't turn on even after trying to do a cold reset or 60sec hold down of the power button.  I have already bought a case and applied a screen protector to it, so thats a loss and part of the shipping that you need to pay from your own pocket which Amazon gratefully reimbursed.  I would rate this product no stars but can't.  KindleHDX here I come!

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Lyn
Reviews.Content: After reading all the excellent reviews, I decided to purchase the asus tablet. While down loading an app my tablet locked up and wouldn't come out of safe mode, even after calling the support tech.I am packaging  and returning it for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Stopped turning on after two weeks!
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom
Reviews.Content: The tablet seemed very nice! My daughter received as a Christmas gift. She used it for a few days and then it became increasingly more difficult to power on (had to make several attempts before it would power up). After just two short weeks, it stopped powering on altogether. Just returned to Amazon and they are sending a replacement. Hope this was a fluke and the new tablet arrives in mint condition. I will update my review after we receive the replacement and use it for a few weeks. For now, very disappointed in this product.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: zilver
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife as a christmas present.  she has been using it for a month now. (got it delivered on the first week of december and she  didnt wait to open it on xmas)  and everything is fine, product came in excellent condition.Cameras are OK for taking casual photos and from camera is excellent for skype or whatsaap.Memory is fair enugh and has a micro sd slot so you can expand to 32gb and store pictures, videos and music on the sd card and save the internal capacity for apps.System performance is great, we have installed a lot of games and the devic has not slowed down.i reccomend this to everyone, is one of the best  7" tables you can get in the range of $150many tables with dual cameras, 16gb are overpriced but this one is not.  and is an ASUS  the same trusted manufacturer as Google NEXUS  7

Reviews.Title: Be Warned: A brick after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: D. Friedland "AmazonShopper217"
Reviews.Content: It was awesome for 2 weeks. Took immaculate care of it, installed only a handful of apps, when I first turned it on, I got System Update Available, and followed the process of updating the Android version. Then on (or abour 1/4/2014), I got another one of those notifications, and went about updating my device again. After taking it's usual long time to install (with no breaks in WiFi connectivity), it rebooted, and rebooted again, and it hasn't stopped for over 24 hrs.So, stuck in the bootloop, and apparently I'm not the only one with this issue. (Feel free to Google it, one keyword I found useful was 'bootloop')I can get to the recovery menu, where you get options to Fastboot, Recovery, or Normal, but none let you escape the infinite bootloop...Oh, and all the while I'm taunted with the screen "ASUS: Inspiring Innovation. Persistent Perfection."I want to stress that I did not do anything out of the ordinary, try to 'root' it, manually install an APK, etc. I merely used it for email (using the pre-installed Gmail app), took a few pictures and videos, changed the wallpaper to one of those pictures, browsed the internet, and played 4 games from the Google Play Store: Plants vs Zombies, Heroes of Dragon Age, Clash of Lords, and Temple Run.

Reviews.Title: Stop working after 2 months
Reviews.Author: JTW "jtw"
Reviews.Content: I know there is always a chance, every now and then, of getting the "dud" when purchasing electronics.  Unfortunately, this particular tablet was a dud.  After 2 months of very minimal use, it just stopped working; wouldn't even come on.  When it was working, still wasn't impressed.  It had some software glitches and the "feel" of the tablet itself was very cheap.  The power/wake-up/sleep button is in a very odd place:  it's on the back-right of the tablet which made its use somewhat difficult and was a nuisance.  I suggest spending a few $$$ more and getting a more reputable brand.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet Low Cost
Reviews.Author: Isidro Estrella Ortíz
Reviews.Content: I think the product its very good and. I love it when I was having its in me hands. I would recommend to anyone. I do not like it does not have HDMI port

Reviews.Title: Good tablet if it powers on
Reviews.Author: Jack  Spratt
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for a Christmas present for my daughter. We were both thrilled with the tablet. It was fast and the display was very good. I was also impressed with the camera. Today, 3 days after she first used it, it won't power on. She is very upset because she loaded a lot of her personal information on it including credit card info. We can't wipe it clean because it does not power on. I am very disappointed with this purchase. Beware folks! I got a good deal on this tablet and now I feel like a fool!!

Reviews.Title: Pad did not start or work after charging for more than 10 hours.
Reviews.Author: Beth Ciaccio
Reviews.Content: I had to send it back because it did't work. They did send me a new one, but I also purchased 5 others for Christmas gifts and I hope that they work.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Larissa
Reviews.Content: So far this is the fastest 7 inch tablet I've tested. The quad core processor makes surfing the web quick. I've had many 7 inch tablets and this is one of the nicest. I have not had a chance to try the Nexus but I do not like the idea of not being able to use microSD card for added memory. This is why I ditched the iPad mini. Netflix plays smoothly.  Overall a nice tablet.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS TABLET!
Reviews.Author: daryle
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A FANTASTIC TABLET! After reading the comments, I was a little concerned about ordering this tablet. I took a chance and I love it.  I am not a newby with tablets.  I have an iPad, an iPad Mini, a Nook Color, a Kindle Fire, and a Nexus.  I reach for this tablet before the others.  The placement of the ear phone and charging plugs are perfect.  When you are holding the tablet in portrait mode, the wires are neatly on top and out of your way.  The on/off button and the volume buttons are also positioned in a comfortable location.  GREAT ENGINEERING ASUS...I ordered the Hot Pink because I am a girly girl and I love it.  If you are considering this resonably priced  tablet, order it and get ready to enjoy your tablet experience.

Reviews.Title: Froze up
Reviews.Author: Ramsil
Reviews.Content: I had it for less than a month and it just froze up on me and I returned it. While it worked, the performance was ok but he on/off and volume buttons on the side were very hard to get to. Overall i was not satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome if they enabled all android features
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet and would rate higher if they didn't disable features. For the money, this is an awesome tablet. However, since they decided to not support OTG (a very common android feature that I need) I reduced the rating and returned the tablet. Their loss!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Jesús Alvarado
Reviews.Content: Overall its a very good device, but it has crashed few times and sometimes lags a lot and not even using many apps at the same time or playing major games, im talking about using skype, draw something, facebook... and thats pretty much it.I was hoping more of a Nexus 7 kinda tablet, but overall for the price its very good and gets the job done

Reviews.Title: good price, works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great price.  My wife warmed to it immediately.  Transition from a Samsung Galaxy was fairly easy.  The touch is not as sensitive as I expected but works OK.  Front camera seems distorted.  wifi sensitivity is better than the Galaxy S.

Reviews.Title: Broken apps, can't upgrade firmware, update fails
Reviews.Author: bboytruen
Reviews.Content: Day one out of box google play app doesn't work along with many other apps. Resetting it to factory defaults doesn't fix it. Even the update will error and crash. In the process of getting it exchanged via amazon. Hope the next work actually works.It's sleek and feels great. Seems like a great tablet if it only worked...

Reviews.Title: Best buy.
Reviews.Author: PEDRO FELIX ESPINAL
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for the price, it has all you need, micro sd, gps, hd resolution and fantastic screen, well done ASUS!

Reviews.Title: MeMO Pad HD 7 Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: Weston JM
Reviews.Content: (Updated on 12/2/2013 after Android 4.2.2 upgrade)Overall:Asus has provided a low cost tablet without cutting corners on the internals. The outside is a bit cheap feeling, but the internal features are great. I own a Surface RT, Surface Pro and an iPad 2. I was considering getting an iPad mini to replace the iPad 2, but after using this device, I'm not sure that is necessary. I wanted something smaller and lighter that still allowed me to browse, view videos, get email, compose small documents, get directions, view eBooks and Skype. This device seems to have the bases covered. Not to say the device does not have flaws. Read the pros and cons below for details. But for the price ($130) this device gets 4 stars from me.Pros:I like the size, weight, screen resolution and battery life of this tablet. It plays Netflix videos well. I can use this all day before needing a recharge. And it runs in idle mode for days without a recharge.The viewing angle is very good.I like the access to system setting and notifications with a swipe down from the top.The floating apps are also nice.After I received the 4.2.2 Android update, I was pleasantly surprised to see that I can now add multiple user accounts to the tablet, each with his/her own password and personalizations.Cons:My biggest complaint is the power button. It is too small and hard to find.I am not a fan of the Android file system.The keyboard does not provide great feedback that a key has been pressed. The key changes from dark to blue when you press it. It would be much better if the key got bigger for a moment.The compass app does not seem to work and there appears to be no way to calibrate it.The rear camera that sticks out on the back prevents you from laying the tablet flat on a table, which makes it difficult to type or tap on it without the tablet jiggling or moving.Windows 8.1 has several nice gestures for switching, killing and getting at app features that Android 4.2 is missing.

Reviews.Title: Terrell Xskinner
Reviews.Author: Xskinner
Reviews.Content: This is a great product by a reliable company like Asus. I recommend this for those who are on a budget and like quality  for their money.

Reviews.Title: Endless nightmare of a tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: This tablet is getting the same fate as the Asus laptop I bought: Going back for a refund! This is the last time I buy Asus! The specs look great for this tablet but in the end its not worth it. It has everything I wanted: GPS, bluetooth, IPS screen, plenty of storage, quad core cpu. I bought this tablet to replace a generic tablet that I use in my car that doesnt have GPS. Primary use has been connecting to 4g, streaming music via bluetooth to the stereo. For that function my generic tablet works GREAT, never have any problems with it, but I wanted GPS so I bought the Memopad.Problems started when trying to connect this to my Virgin wifi 4g hotspot. After less than a minute the connection would freeze. It would say it was connected but it wouldnt transfer data and give network errors. My other devices (phone and Acer laptop) have no problem maintaining the connection to the hotspot. After hours of trial and error the only way to make this work was to disable wifi security on my hotspot. I did this and then the tablet would stay connected. What a terrible work-around, but I could live with this.Next was syncing the bluetooth to my car stereo, which wasn't a problem. But once the bluetooth is connected the tablet displays "bluetooth has stopped" errors every few minutes. This is really annoying when trying to use google maps for nav. Nothing I could do would make this error stop, except disabling bluetooth altogether.After a full charge, which surprisingly only took 1 hour, the tablet lasted for about 2. Far cry from the 10 its advertising. For my purpose wouldnt be a problem because I would keep it connected to the charger at all times anyways but buyer discretion anyways. For full disclosure the screen was on most of the time of this 2 hours which probably drained if fast but it advertises up to 10 hours! 2 hours is just long enough for one movie - which you would be using the screen the entire time for anyways.Now I cant even get it to turn back on! The screen is black and plugging it in to charge doesnt bring up the battery charge indicator anymore. Since this is a very common charge plug (samsung style) I have many chargers laying around but none of them work so that's ruled out. I have let the tablet sit for most of the day hoping it would recover but no luck. Dead as a nail leaving me no choice but to return it. Sad because Ive only had this thing for two days. Actually I should be happy that it died now instead of in a few months outside of the warranty.This is my 2nd bad experience with an Asus product. My other purchase was their high-end touchscreen 1080p laptop. Nothing but problems with every aspect of that laptop and had to return it. This is the last straw for them. The price of their products is tempting but obviously they skipped the quality control to make their stuff more affordable! I cannot recommend anything they make to anyone!

Reviews.Author: Walter Sanchez Chaves
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a Christmas gift for my daughter and it worked well the first day, but after two months had problems and now I'm processing a claim to see if I change the product as my daughter is very sad.

Reviews.Title: Power issues with this tablet.
Reviews.Author: J. Watkins
Reviews.Content: The ASUS Memopad HD7 seemed like it was a great little tablet, and I wanted one with a microSD slot.But one night it needed a charge, so I charged it, and in the morning, the tablet was dead. Worked just over a month.I love ASUS monitors, I will stick with those from now on..Plus, the android marketplace is so fragmented, many many apps were incompatible with this device.Apple products are overpriced and don't last, so it's back to Windows for me.. Adios Android. I gave you a chance!

Reviews.Title: This tablet is horriable
Reviews.Author: Tazz T
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet in December 2013. When I got the tablet it turned on and worked great. Next day the tablet would not even turn on. I sent it back to exchange thinking that is was defective. Well I got the replacement in the mail on January 15, 2013. And this tablet turned on just one time. And it has not turned on again. Asus I thought made great tablets. but after reading other reviews of other customers. This is Tablet should be pulled off the market. Horrible tablet. DO NOT BUY!.

Reviews.Title: I think it is JUNK!
Reviews.Author: Wowly
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon on September 7 so I have used for almost 3 months. Everything was great and I really loved this tablet, then it started losing the wireless connection constantly.  My computer was working so I guess the tablet is not working anymore. I guess from what others have said in reviews about this problem  not much I can do but trash it. Oh well I will not buy another product that has the Asus name on it.  I am on fixed income and cannot afford to replace the tablet so I guess I learned a lesson!

Reviews.Title: Good value but weak wifi issue for me.
Reviews.Author: Pankaj Sharma "Living e-life"
Reviews.Content: Update 1:Second unit stopped charging at the end of 4th week! Luckily Amazon refunded my money on 31st day of return period. This is the first device I have owned that gave up on charging so quickly.================================================================================================================Memo pad is great value. I really like the screen and weight of this tablet. I use it mainly for reading offline during the train commute but also use it for light browsing at home.The first unit stopped charging within 3 weeks. Amazon promptly replaced it. The second one survived the charging test but showing issues related to Wi-Fi. Someone had noted that the tablet has weak Wi-Fi radio. Well it's the same for me. I am sitting at a point in my house where all my devices are showing maximum Wi-Fi signal strength. Wheeras the memo pad is at the least level.I have an iPad and couple of smartphones in my house that move around the house but never show weak(lowest) Wi-Fi signal.The problem does not end there. The tablet drops connection every now and then. I don't know if it is because I move around in the house (as far as I know there are no dead zones in my house) or its the tendency of the hardware. It's quite frustrating at this point. It could be a defective piece also but my confidence levels have gone very low. I can't deal with WiFi issues for a device that is mainly WiFi.Asus has done well with the software. The android version is not bloated and gives enjoyable experience. Battery is good but can't be compared to the beast like iPad. Surprisingly the camera is good for a tablet.

Reviews.Title: 2 Defective units
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Overall I really like this little tablet but I've had to return 2 for the same defect, SD card will unmount and mount when applying pressure to certain areas.This tablet has a nice screen resolution, standalone GPS, bluetooth, and its quick to respond. I'm would like to think that I was just unlucky and this isn't a trend from Asus.

Reviews.Title: Was enjoying it....
Reviews.Author: Gary Belton
Reviews.Content: Well I must say for a budget tablet this little device surprised me!  It is fast enough to handle all of my casual gaming needs and works great as a kindle alternative. The reason for my three stars begins here.  I finally got to put my rooCASE on it today and then my wife noticed a problem.  She saw an artifact right in the middle of the screen!  At first she thought she had scratched the screen protector but upon further investigation (and removing the screen protector) I found out that this "artifact" indeed is a defect in the screen and not the protector or glass.  I am regrettably shipping it back tomorrow for a full refund and will be looking for another tablet to suit my needs.  If you are considering this table I wish you better luck than we had!

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted...
Reviews.Author: jeremy stratton
Reviews.Content: Loved this tab till today, went to use it and it was dead. Wouldn't charge or turn on, only a week old!  Girl friends is 2 weeks old and working fine, hopefully I got a lemon and the replacement will be good... Will update.. As usual though amazon customer service was first rate and a new one is on the way.

Reviews.Title: This is a piece of garbage !!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Yang
Reviews.Content: This is a piece of garbage !!!After charging for 8 hours, 1st time boot up OK.Updated system as instructed by ASUS software.2nd time boot up OK.Headset also works, but the internal speaker is active at the same time.Why would I want to annoy my partner while I have the headset in my ears?That is so dumb !!!After I remove the headset, the power button fail to launch the shutdown popup window.I tried various options, including holding the power button for 8 seconds to 20 seconds.Nothing works, the screen simply goes on and off, but Android is still active.After about 30 minutes of frustrating attempts, the shutdown popup window eventually shows up.I shutdown Android and leave the tablet on the computer desk.About 6 hours later, I couldn't power up the tablet.  Even the Asus logon is not showing.Again, I tried holding the power buttons for 2 seconds, 8 seconds, 30 seconds, whatever ...Nothing works.The screen remains dark and it won't even flash like the previous successful boot up sequence I have observed.There is no indicator lights can be found anywhere.Initially, I thought 6 hours of sleeping ( even though it was power off ) probably have drained the battery.So I use the USB cable ( provided by Asus ) to recharge the tablet.Amazingly, the screen display the battery logo and it goes to fully charged within 10 seconds.So the darn tablet is not discharged in the fist place.Well, now I need help to return this tablet.Anyone has good suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Don't bother...on my 2nd one in just over a month
Reviews.Author: J. M. B. Utley
Reviews.Content: On the first one, within 48 hours the home screen froze and I could not even shut it down.  I exchanged it and it was quickly replaced with no issue from Amazon.  The new one was even sent to me before I had even sent the defective one back.  And now the 2nd one won't even accept the pattern password, unlocking then re-locking immediately.  Shutting it off and restarting has not corrected it.  And since it is 30 days past the purchase date I can no longer exchange or return it.  When it is working, it's a nice, responsive, clear tablet.  Otherwise it's a pain in the ass and I strongly suggest a purchase of a Samsung or something.  BTW...this was for my 8 yr old son.  Even put a screen protector on it and put it in a case.  It has not been dropped, banged on, or damaged in any way.  My son used it sporadically for game apps.

Reviews.Title: smooth and fast
Reviews.Author: duketdub
Reviews.Content: The battery leaves something to be desired, but it serves its purpose. Im enjoying the android platform and will defimately own another android device. In short, battery life and memory limitations are whats keeping this device short of all five stars.

Reviews.Title: touch screen stops working
Reviews.Author: J. Rasmussen "jbred1978"
Reviews.Content: I've had two of these now and within 2 months the touch screen stops working or it fails to turn on.  Buy something higher quality with more than a 30 day return policy!

Reviews.Title: Pls dont buy
Reviews.Author: Amjad
Reviews.Content: First, the camera is terrible. Second, the screen is not good, and third the performance is also terrible. So do not buy

Reviews.Title: Excellent device for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew Mathenge "World Architect"
Reviews.Content: I use this device mainly to read books and watch movies on Netflix and I find it great for the price ($150). But I've also purchased Autodesk Sketchbook Express, and it's amazingly smooth. The closest device in terms of weight and size would be the iPad Air, but there's no reason to buy an iPad Air for almost 8 to 9 times more money, for marginally better experience. Once of the minor issues is the battery life. When watching movies, you may be able to get 6 or 7 hours. It's OK, but I know that the iPad Air does about twice this. Still, there's no reason to buy an iPad Air just to read books and watch Netflix or draw on Sketchbook, if I can do all that on this device.

Reviews.Title: great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Had actually got this for my elderly mother so she could skype with family and friends that live out of state.  I had to get familiar with it so I could show her how to use it, and ended up liking it so much I got one for myself! The ASUS is simple, easy and fast... does not jam up  or crash, and the battery lasts quite awhile!

Reviews.Title: Awsome!
Reviews.Author: sunshinye
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love my tablet.  it is the right size. I love the green color.  It is so clear.  I love that it is 7 inches so I can hold it in my hand.  I can't wait to get my case to go with it.

Reviews.Title: charging cord is junk
Reviews.Author: talkin
Reviews.Content: The tablet is nice but the charging cable is junk. I got this as a Christmas gift for my mother in law. She was loving it. Then i got the call, its broke. It was past the return window for Amazon. I drove 20 miles to her house to look at it. She said it wont turn on. I plugged her charger in to it and nothing. Just for giggles I decided to try my Razor M charger and boom . It lit up and said CHARGING. After charging its worked fine. I left her with my cable and bought a new one. If it wasnt for that I would of gave it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We got this and two Samsung Galaxy tablets.  This tablet is a great value and performs well.  I don't regret getting it for our 5-year-old daughter.

Reviews.Title: It was a gift for a friend.
Reviews.Author: Madonna Davis
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a friend for their birthday.  They really like it.  They use it every day.  It's a great product.

Reviews.Title: highly recommend
Reviews.Author: DENISE M BOWLER
Reviews.Content: Referred from an IT friend of mine... no need for ipad that costs 300 or more!Completely worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: I have to give it 3 stars
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Memopad because it has a quad processor and 10 hour battery life.  I have not had it a week and it turned off and will not turn back on.  One thing I can say is, when it was running it was everything that I wanted it to be.  It processed quickly, it downloads games rather quickly.  The games played well and the picture quality was very good.  It worked for everything I used it for but I am not satisfied with the fact that its been less that a week since I received it and I have to exchange it.  I purchased this item new and not refurbished.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time.
Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: The good:It uses Android 4.2.2The bad:Its existenceLet me start off by saying that my main reason for purchasing this tablet was for reading.  I figured the other functionality would be a bonus.I’ve had a kindle paperwhite for a while now and I LOVED it.  Being able to read in the dark without an external light is amazing.  I wanted to upgrade a bit so I figured I’d shop around for something to replace it.  For the price, I noticed there was a whole line-up of tablets available.  I was so excited to see I could get a tablet in my price range!When I buy something, I research it at great lengths before I make the purchase.  I probably spent 3-4 hours combing over the different tablet sand their features.  It came down to the Asus MemoPad HD 7 and the Kindle fire HD 7 (the new version).  Since I’d already owned a kindle I was leaning that way…but the Asus was 10 dollars cheaper (at the time) and it was more android friendly.  What I mean by that is it runs a fairly straight forward android system (4.2.2).  While the Fire uses android, Amazon tweaks it to the point where you don’t recognize that it’s android.  My though was, “I’ll just put the kindle app on the asus and POOF, instant kindle with full android features”.The degree to which I was wrong is immeasurable.  Out of the box, this thing felt like something you’d give a child.  The tablet was actually flexing and creaking when held.  I instantly knew I had made the wrong choice.  Booting up, I could see the Asus logo was pixelated and the boot times were incredibly long.  I had to manually install two system updates (to upgrade to 4.2.2) which took about an hour.  At times I thought the unit was simply frozen because it went so long without doing anything.  Once it was up and running, I say down to read with the kindle app.  The first thing I noticed was the light grey background to the books.  I thought that was strange since I’d never seen that option before with the app.  Turns out the light grey that I was seeing is Asus’s version of white.  The text was jagged and hard to read against that background.  Even changing the background the sepia created a washed out look.  I couldn’t believe how bad this “HD” display was.Day 3 was when I finally decided this thing purchase mistake.  I went to power it on and got no response.  I thought that was odd and held the power button a bit longer and still nothing.  So I think that the battery died and I go to plug it in…with no response at all.  Uhg. I head to the internet to research what’s wrong. It Turns out this is a very common problem with this unit.  I had to hold the power button (I timed this) for a full 1 minute and 22 seconds to get the unit to power on.  At this point, I couldn’t return it fast enough.My advice:If you want a device mainly for reading and at least some tablet functionality, stick with the Kindle line.  This is even more so if you’re a prime member.  The integration of the various amazon options (like the Kindle store and prime instant video) is seamless and hassle-free.  I’ve since had the pleasure to use the new Kindle Fire HD 7 and Kindle Fire HDX 7, both creating an incredibly enjoyable experience.TLDR; At this price point, buy a Kindle

Reviews.Title: good purchase
Reviews.Author: howard
Reviews.Content: So far so good thank you for your ratings got it based on the positive feedback now very glad I did.Great buy..I work in the desktop support field . AMD am very pleased for the $, ya cant go wrong here.good buy.

Reviews.Title: best tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: ben
Reviews.Content: This tablet is super light and super quick! Great camera... Only issue is there aren't many fun cases for it... But the value isn't to be missed!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: M. Guzman
Reviews.Content: THEY ARE GREAT WORK FINE AND DO WHAT  WE WANTED THEM FOR. NO COMPLAINTS. VERY SATISFIED  WITH THERE PERFORMANCE. I WOULD RECOMMEND THEM.

Reviews.Title: Can't do better for the price.
Reviews.Author: Keith Carnley
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I didn't want to spend a fortune for it. I read a LOT of reviews and compared a lot of models before deciding to buy this. The reviews on this tablet were hands down the best for anything priced $200 and under. It's fast, smooth, great picture, does everything would expect.If I HAD to pick something negative... does not come with an SD card.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: isaiah Thomas
Reviews.Content: bought this for my wife as an upgrade to the previous asus version. so far it meets all expectations, ideal speed, lots of apps, front and rear camera, good battery life to name a few.if you are looking for something for everyday fun and what not, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: Disapointed
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Great unit for the price BUT Can't install adobe flash player. Adobe stopped upgrading it for tablets and Google blocks installing flash player. Something in the software blocks installing it through the 'back door' also. Now it has 50% usefulness.

Reviews.Title: Memo Rocks!!
Reviews.Author: muneca
Reviews.Content: I bought this little gem after returning a kindle fire hd 16gb that was nothing but trouble.  The fire crapped out within 8 hours of unboxing it. Amazon customer service is really phenomenal.  They sent a new one, but alas it had the same issues. I was very disappointed. Sent it packing and got a refund.  I looked and looked for a different tablet.  I researched this one and took the plunge.  I have had it for over a week and it is awesome!!  Not a single glitch, performs flawlessly. The HD picture is fabulous. It runs netfix without a hitch. Google has tons of great apps. The camera (which the fire did not have) takes great pictures.  I could not be happier with this purchase.  It was less expensive than the Kindle and has expandable memory, microphone, and front and back cameras.  The only thing that is not quite as good as the fire is the sound.  The sound on the memo is very good, but the dolby on the fire was incredible. I would highly recommend the moko cover for it. It fits like a glove and is so well made.  All the cutouts for cameras and buttons fit perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: MARGARET C DENTICE
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for about a week and . it has been performing wonderfully. Occasionally the screen isn't as responsive as I would like but I have a much more expensive Lenovo tab that can do that too. This tablet I am highly recommending as a very reasonable device.

Reviews.Title: All excellent but micro-HDMI port
Reviews.Author: yi b doo
Reviews.Content: Everything one could expect from this $149 (now $20+ cheaper) tablet is as stated in most positive comments already. One thing it is missing is a micro-HDMI output port...unless if I can wait till Asus miracast dongle to drop to Chromecast's level.

Reviews.Title: Lacks multi-user setting out of the box; it MIGHT update. Otherwise, feels solid.
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Meadows
Reviews.Content: (My original review is below, I have added updates further below. Overall this seems like a good tablet for the price, especially considering the features)Lacks the multi-user setting. We bought this tablet SPECIFICALLY for use between my wife and my two preschool children. Other Android 4.2 devices have a multi-user setting.
